description:
Atmosphere:B
Presentation:B
Taste:A+
Cleanliness:A
wait time:A
Price:A

Best place to eat for late night.
author: Siavash M.

description:
the food is disgusting. trash. the to go pick up area is not organized and it takes forever to order food for pick up. it is such a horrible environment. 

the food is bad. the fried rice is too spicy. the spice is not delicious but a bad kind of spice. it is too strong. 

the grilled pork shoulder had a musky smell. it was not fresh and tasted old and frozen.

the yellow curry was too scrimpy on chicken. the potatoes were not cooked well. horrible horrible horrible

they also have a poor rating by health inspectionand have rats and rodents roaming around
author: Angelo P.

description:
Open late, but doesn't taste great!

The only good thing about this place is it's open till 2am.

One night I decided to try their tom yum soup with chicken. The soup was pretty good. But the at the price of $17 (including tax) for one order of soup, the prices definitely do not match what is displayed on their website! 

The next time I ordered pad thai, Penang curry with short rib (per recommendation), papaya salad with crab, and again the same soup. The food was nasty and mostly ended up thrown away! The pad thai was noodles slathered in oil but no actual sauce of any kind. The Penang curry nuts that had rotted! Most disappointing was to pay $70 for such lousy food. 

Definitely will NOT be coming back here.
author: Zahra H.

description: I went on a weekday during their lunch special. For $15 you can select one of their stir fry dishes off the lunch menu along with a curry from the lunch menu, and an egg roll. It was definitely a lot of food for the price which was nice. My only real complaint was the lack of selection from the lunch options. You must dine in for this lunch deal. Overall it was a good meal, with fast service. I also like the shrimp fried rice here. The food here is fairly spicy here as well, which is a major plus.
author: Wilton F.

description: The BEST Thai I have had in 30 years!! Awesome job on food and service. Have to come back because too many great choices on menu!! HIGHLY, HIGHLY RECOMMEND. Pricing is VERY reasonable to add to an already great experience.
author: John H.

description:
The husband and I were hungry and cold, and randomly stopped in for a bite at iThai. We got the roti and curry appetizer which was beautifully presented. I wish I had taken a picture, but we scarfed it down as soon as it hit the table.  needless to say, it was good. There were 4 pieces, decorated with pell pepper and basil leaves, presented on a plate with green curry. 
We also ordered the crab fried rice, which was also good and the crispy pork belly with Chinese broccoli. The pork belly was super crispy and generous, and the broccoli soaked up the delicious sauce and was delicious. 
Overall, we had a good experience. The dishes we had were all good and the staff are very friendly and attentive.
author: Sarah K.

description:
Excellent quick Thai food. I had the lunch special and it was a to of food! Been playing with a vegetarian diet and they had some great options that were filling. I'd come back again. Plus right across the street from my hotel. 

Oh and get the Thai coffee
author: Lance P.

description: Avearge food. It's good for a late night snack. The larb was okayish. Pro tip - extra spicy is REALLY spicey.
author: Rohan K.

description: iThai has been one of my favorite places to go in the area ever since I checked it out. One dish I really love is their fried rice - it's so good and spicy! I went with a couple of friends this past Saturday and unfortunately the service was not as good as I had anticipated and left my friends and I feeling a little awkward. We ordered a beer tower but they didn't even bring us water until the very end of our meal - which is something I was really confused about. Hopefully next time this is not the case and the service is better. Was definitely a little disappointed
author: Alysia T.

description:
Ordered from this place for delivery through Eat24. I was looking for something authentic and that would be true Thai spicy when you order spicy. Boy, it's pretty spicy! I love it but next time will probably order medium so I can enjoy it more without needing to take breaks. 

Highly recommend the krapao aka basil chicken! Very flavorful with basil leaves, bell peppers, onions, juicy chicken, and lots of chilies! Delicious though! Also recommend the pad kee mao with beef. Very spicy as well; I could see the chili seeds sprinkled all over and every bit was intense. 

Would definitely order to go again. It's pretty quick...even though it estimated delivery would take an hour 15 minutes it came 25 minutes sooner.
author: Melissa L.

description: Overpriced Thai food near union square that is tasty and open 24 hours. Honestly, the food is good but the pricing doesn't reflect the portions but whatever. The spicy eggplant is super spicey and that makes me happy.
author: Frank L.

description:
Ordered from Postmates
Got egg rolls
Jasmin rice
Roti
Yellow curry
It tasted quite good but was super greasy and totally made me sick- will not be ordering again
author: Julia S.

description: This is the review for the delivery. If you ever think about order delivery, better don't order from this restaurant and grubhub. I was waiting more than 2 hours at my hotel for the food and the deliver person said they gave it to my mother. Everytime when you go out to deliver,you need to call the customer on the phone so they can confirm and come out to get the order. By the way, I'm staying alone with no mother or father. Any strangers could pretend to be the mother to get the food while the real one is starving.Now i want my refund. My order number is 205604598085363. Order at 8:34pm on 06/16/18. I don't want to waste my money on the terrible service.
author: Joyce V.

description:
This's hidden gem for this area! The most authentic Thai restaurant where becomes my regular place for Thai food
If u want the real thai food, u should come here
The staffs are very nice and friendly 
My favorite dishes here are Pad-Kra -pow and Pad see u
author: Yokyok N.

description: Potatoes in the chicken curry weren't cooked entirely...earthy AF.  Some of the meat was rubbery and questionable.  Coconut soup to go was 40 oz of mushroom mess.
author: Teyo B.

description: Great authentic Thai food! Great taste and nice people. Polite delivery man.
author: Tanyaporn T.

description:
GET THE Kao Pad Kraprow FRIED RICE. JUST GET IT. Spicy and delicious. So delicious. The duck noodles are also quite tasty, but I can't vouch for them like the Kao Pad Kraprow fried rice. 

Everything else is just OK. I've been disappointed by their stale egg roles more than once. 

The restaurant itself is super dark, but that's fine when you're only ever ordering Kao Pad Kraprow fried rice to go. 

They're open late and speedy with to go orders; always ready before original estimated pick up time.
author: Christina G.

description: This is still my favorite thai restaurant out of all the places I've been to. Their food always tastes good and portions are always big. Thai food is usually overpriced but I think this place has it at a decent price. The reason why I'm giving it three stars is because of the service I encountered today. My friend and I walked in at an awkward time around 5pm so there was literally no one in there. When we walked in, we weren't greeted or anything, nor did the lady in the front acknowledge us till we said hi. Ummm what the heck??? She then told us to sit wherever we liked so we sat down and she brought the menu over to us right after. I already knew what I wanted and so did my friend, so we waited for her to come back to our table to take our order. I literally had to say three times "I'm ready to order!" for her to come to us. I have no idea what she was doing because hello, we were the only ones in the restaurant until later. Besides this rude service, I enjoyed the food like I always do!! I will of course still come back because it's my favorite Thai restaurant. It's just weird because service is usually on point besides today.
author: Lisa W.

description: So i ordered some kao moo dang and some kao pad gai tod. And i found this in my food. Lol im not going to lie it was good until i found this . Im completely disgusted. Im just glad i was the one who found this and not anyone else that wasn't paying attention. Please watch what you get from there because this looked like piece of metal with a point inside that looked a little green around it so did the meat. Im thinking of seeking and taking this in a much farther manner. I need some opinions. AND PLEASE SHARE THIS SO THAT OTHER WOULD BE AWARE. if this didnt happened i would've given you guys 5stars. Please be careful what you serve your costumers.
author: Joshua R.

description:
Great place! The food is amazing! The service is fast and very friendly. For sure a 5 Star place. 

I will be recommending this place to everyone I know that loves food Thai food.
author: Amos M.

description: Everything was wonderful!  The staff - very pleasant and welcoming.  The decor - understated, which is nice after the continuous bombardment of the senses that is S.F.  The food - so, so good.  I was with 3 others who had little to no experience with Thai food.  We started with Tom Yom Goon soup and it was the best I've ever had!  All 3 were won over immediately.  Pad Thai, Pranum something or other (beef w/peanut sauce over veggies) and a shrimp dish with glass noodles.  All were good.  Add rice and cucumber salad and a bill that was just $60?  Hard to do better than that.
author: Marcella E.

description:
The worst Thai delivery experience I've ever had.  

Ordered lunch for 8 people at work today.  NONE of the food came labeled.  We had no idea which food belonged to which person.  

One of the noodle orders was supposed to be chicken and they made it with beef.  

On top of that, food quality was poor, noodles were too hard and EVERY SINGLE curry dish came spilled!  EVERY SINGLE ONE...like they didn't close the lid properly or purchased cheap containers. 

Never again.
author: Vi Y.

description: Food was great but service was really slow. The ginger  garlic rice and chicken curry was outstanding. I can eat the rice by itself.
author: Jun G.

description: We came here as we were staying very close by with some friends. We were NOT greeted well and found the staff very rude and not friendly at all. I was extremely shocked at the attitude the waiter gave and will NOT be coming back. Food was mediocre and the plates were dirty. We did not enjoy our time. Spend your money somewhere else!
author: Jack L.

description:
Love these guys. An excellent deal on Thai with late hours, perfect for post-bar munchies--and even better if you love Thai karaoke! Good for tables of two and for large groups.

I wouldn't mind a few more vegetables but almost everything I've had is on point: Spices sear at the right speed, coconut soups offer layer upon layer of flavor, and I've seen few places Thai or otherwise that offer such a straightforward and well-prepared presentation of grilled calamari. A recent menu update is an improvement and adds an impressive array of choices.

Service is friendly and always prompt and efficient, and they're lightning quick on takeout. Far and away the best overall Thai option in the neighborhood, worthy of your attention both early and late, especially when you're hungry and not looking to break the bank.
author: James D.

description: This place will definietly be my most favorite Thai place in SF.  I ordered yum woonsen, grilled pork, yen-ta-fo, hoi-tod, yum-pladook foo. There are all super delicious. If you wanna tried authentic THAI food, I suggest iThai.
author: Pinyapon D.

description: The girls working the front doesn't have the greatest customer service. Overall spring rolls was bland and expensive for a couple pieces.
author: T P.

description: Got delivered on a Friday night. The fried rice dishes were yummy but the Giew Tod were burnt and both noodle dishes were over cooked mush.  Only place I've seen have Mussamun lately. Won't try again as delivery.
author: Marilyn C.

description: I ordered delivery from this place after I got off a long transcontinental flight.  It's open until 1230, which is a god send when you're having to burn the midnight oil.  I ordered a chicken pad kee mao and stir fried veggies.  The pad kee mao was delicious--simple but flavorful.  Didn't include a whole mess of stuff that a lot of thai places do that make your pad kee mao end up looking like a brunch stir fry w/the entire kitchen sink thrown into the skillet.  The veggies were good, seasoned w/oyster sauce, and not overly salty.  The prices were reasonable too.  I'd definitely repeat my business here.
author: Crystal C.

description: Why can't the SF Bay get Thai right? This place was no exception to my disappointment. Something is missing; maybe it's the Holy Basil. Maybe it's the water. Maybe it's the clientele. Whatever it is, this is Americanized Thai for techie bot-people and hipsters. Even the names for the food on the menu are barely recognizable as authentic Thai. They make a fried rice sauteed in ketchup dish. Gross! I'm going to fall to my knees and worship the ground when I get back to Thai Town in LA. Two stars only because it was a smidgen better than the stuff I threw in the trash last night, and it was delivered in a timely manner.
author: Kali K.

description:
The last time I ate at a Thai restaurant was in Miami.  This place was the only restaurant open in the area on a Monday night.  I wasn't expecting much and I had not eaten the entire day since I was flying from the east coast and weather "ate" my entire layover.  I literally had to run from one end of O'Hare to the other.

I was looking for something light but not a salad.  I decided on the Pla Rad Kang which didn't look too spicy.  I didn't mention spice level and figured it would be fine however it came.  I should have ordered the salmon underdone as I usually like it, but it was just fine.  The sauce and salmon with vegetables really complimented each other.  I would have had a Sapporo but it was late.  I normally leave most of the sauce but this was so good I signed up for the clean plate (bowl) club.

Place was quiet and very elegant, service was attentive and friendly, and the prices are very reasonable.

I WILL be back.
author: Keith S.

description:
We've eaten at iThai before and always loved to the place until we ordered online! ); we were disappointed that one of our entrees were significantly smaller than usual. And it does $11, so it's disappointing to pay that much for so little. We're not sure if that's the new size or something happened in the kitchen, but beware of ordering to go folks!! 

Bottom line: the food is still good, but if the portion is this size, it's a bit pricey!
author: Tandra N.

description: The food is actually quite palatable, albeit forgettable. But the service, what are these guys thinking? From the first main dish to the last, a good thirty minutes, absolutely no excuse. If you don't want to end your night terribly frustrated, stay away!
author: Jaime L.

description: The flavor was quite different here than other places. The first bite of every dish had a special smell. It was not a taste from the dish but a layer above it. The mango ice cream tastes good.
author: Xi L.

description: Excellent food for a good price. Choose between different types of rice of course, and a lot of curry's! I chose one of the recommended curry's that said "one of the most popular curry's" in the menu. Two chilli was the sign in the menu, and the waiter was very good at referring to how strong it was for us "not-very-used-to-strong-food-people". Two chillis was perfect, and a lot of flavours in the meals.
author: Karin S.

description:
It was late one night and we were craving for some thai food. Somehow we stumbled upon this gem - iThai! 

Amazing food and they even have karoke at night. The food was actually really good considering it was a late night snack at midnight. We ordered the pad see ew, pad kee mao, crab fried rice, crispy pork belly,and  tom yum kha, 

If you are ever craving thai food, whether it be a midnight snack or early afternoon lunch, get your thai fix here!
author: Linette F.

description: I ordered a mango sticky rice, the box comes with 2 rice but no mango.......the other orders was fine
author: Ryan W.

description: I have just order a Pad Kee Mao Nuer through Doordash and got it mild. But when the food arrived the food was covered with chili seeds and flakes. It definitely didn't taste or look like mild. I wish they had payed more attention to customers requests. That was $11 to waste.
author: Judy C.

description: Delicious food. We ordered egg rolls, crab fried rice & iThai beef. Sooo yummy. Fast service, our server was so sweet! Nice little spot in SF! Thank you!!
author: Shelly M.

description: iThai delivered undercooked frozen egg rolls which were completely horrible. I threw out the whole lot. The flake on the egg rolls was completely white and not even cooked. I can't believe this restaurant can't even properly bake and brown frozen egg rolls. I had the Tom Kha soup with shrimp which was a little better but overall would rate this place way below average. I can't believe they serve those frozen egg rolls and a generic sauce which they do not make! Will never go back.
author: Anne R.

description:
Very good Thai food. The green papaya salad was very fresh and perfectly sweet, salty, and spicy (a little too spicy for the Bf). We ordered it medium spice and it was pretty spicy, even for me who loveeeeee spicy! The Bf was sweatin' like a hooker at church! The Pad Sew Mao Nuer (sp?) was excellent, we substituted the beef for tofu and added egg for a vegetarian option and it was bommmmb. 

I had the fried chicken over fried rice. Rice was very good and flavorful but I deducted one star because the chicken lacked flavor. The chicken tasted like white people fried chicken, probably was only seasoned with salt and pepper, coated in flour and fried. I like my chicken with at least some garlic salt and onion powder thrown in; it was also a bit on the dry side. 

The mangosteen juice . Get it! 

Would definitely come back!
author: Lina L.

description: The greatest Thai restaurant in San Francisco!  I was craving Khao Soi Beef this morning and then I found this spot. It's really good Thai restaurant ever!!! #itwasBOMB
author: Gningerr T.

description:
I got the Kaprow Gai and it was fairly tasty and not overpowering like many other restaurants. I asked for medium spicy and even that was fairly spicy, so I would say medium spicy on the Asian scale. The Kaprow Gai does not come with rice as is the case with much of their menu because most of their dishes are meant to be shared with other people. For that reason, this place is a nice place to bring your family or friends! 

I also ordered their mango and sticky rice desert to try something new. It was warm slightly sweet sticky rice surrounded by fresh mangos. Cool thing to try, but don't expect to be blown away.

That being said, the prices are on the higher side ($15+ range for most meals), so I don't recommend it for frequent takeout / dine-in.

Overall, great tasting Thai food, but on the pricey side, so I don't see myself coming here often.
author: Michael M.

description: We went very late at night and, frankly, were grateful to have a downtown Thai option available.  Food was quite good, and the entire staff was very solicitous.  The live music -- about which the staff warned us -- was ear-splitting, and the room was too dark to view the menu without a flashlight!  Overall, an interesting experience.  But next time, I think we'll do delivery or take-out.
author: George L.

description:
Delivery via Eat24 arrived 20 minutes before schedule, and my Medium-spicy orders were Asian spicy. Yes yes and YES!! Thank you!!

We ordered chicken yellow curry and beef phad ki mao. The phad ki mao was generous with beef slices, and the yellow curry just enough "stuff." 

I'll gladly take this place over Osha any day!
author: Hannah Y.

description: I was not impressed with this at all and I'm used to eating really good Thai food.  The eggrolls were  tad greasy and the inside of them had a thick part of the eggroll wrapper that was kind of mushy on the inside as opposed to the typical spring roll which has dainty  crunchy exterior.  The Pad Thai was a bit greasy and the shrimp were not fresh it had a slightly fishy taste to it.  Very surprised as I was directed this place is an authentic Thai restaurant and I would characterize it as a greasy spoon Thai restaurant.
author: Gregg O.

description: Ordered finger foods through Eat24 for a team shindig. Timely delivery of the curry puffs, chicken skewers, steamed veg, and spring rolls. The appetizers were boxed well to avoid getting soggy, which is much appreciated for a delivery/takeout order. Fair prices for quality food. Would definitely order again.
author: Alison A.

description:
Food was superb!! We ordered house fried rice with tofu and green curry with tofu. Both dishes were outstanding - only wish she had brought these two dishes together so we enjoyed them more. I was so hungry that I began with the rice and by the time the curry dish came, it was almost all gone :(.  

Service was 3-4 so they don't get my 5 stars but the food is definitely a 5!!
author: Xochi R.

description:
Dear Mr. Jay C. of IThai,

To answer your question, I wrote my review right after I left your restaurant, Friday 7/8.  And to be clear, you had at least 3 servers there that night and many empty tables.  When I have dined in previously, you only have your usual 2. The female and male server.  I was told specifically, ''On Friday nights, we close at 10:30 for 'private parties'''.  Right after I was told that, the same male server seated 2 Thai customers and took their order.  Additionally, he was very rude to me and snapped at me saying he didn't have chili or soy sauce when I asked for it.  Thanks for your response after an entire week...yes, maybe you should retrain your staff in customer service and/or make your seating policies more transparent, because as of right now- there are not even restaurant times posted in front of your restauant.  Good day.
author: Phan ..

description: Very yummy Thai food! We were walking by and decided to try it and it was definitely worth it. We loved their charbroiled pork shoulders. I enjoyed complimentary shrimp chips. Tom yum soup was great as well. Service was good as well. We'll come back!
author: Justyna M.

description:
My best friend & I ordered for delivery & it came within an hour or less.

We had gotten the egg rolls (it wasn't that good, hardly any flavor), the pad Thai (spicy), which was super spicy & mediocre & the lemon grass chicken (sweet)

For 3 things it was $27. My best friend & I didn't eat all the food because it really wasn't that great.
author: Phoebe T.

description: I ordered delivery yesterday, the arrival time was in hour, i got it in 30 minutes, I ordered only vegetarian food, green carry was so good! The soup was super hot, 10 stars for this time !
author: Ohad B.

description:
Overall, not impressed. I should have been forewarned by the suspicious smell that crept into my nose upon first entering this establishment. Now, don't get me wrong, this place isn't bad. But it's just that Thai food places are a dime a dozen in this city, and I could have gone to any of them and probably had good that was just as good, if not better. Also, this place is super dark on the inside. Feels like I'm at the club (there's also a small stage in the rear of the restaurant). I could barely read the menu. What I could read resulted in me ordering the fish cakes appetizer and shrimp pad Thai. I didn't like the fish cakes. The texture was a bit too soft for me, and a bit, well, FISHY! 

The pad Thai was alright, but they put dried shrimps in as well, and I found those to be a bit chewy. But it wasn't terrible (because I definitely finished the entire thing in one sitting- don't just me, I was hangry). 

Overall, this is an okay place however I don't see myself going out of the way to go back. But if you're looking for something different or just. Bit curious, then go for it. Additionally, the name is a bit deceiving to some. I totally thought this place had some relation to Apple. But nope, it appears this is just a second removed cousin to the McIntosh empire. 

Likes:
-centrally located
-pretty expansive menu
-friendly customer service 

Dislikes:
-dark decor (great if you're going to/from the club and want to get the ambiance started early...or wanna keep it going)
-food was a bit unremarkable
author: Tracy T.

description: I ordered Khao-nah-gai for dinner and it was the worst khao-nah-gai ever. There was no authenticity. The chicken was dried and it was spicy. (khao nah gai should not be spicy)
author: Rarin T.

description: Holy crap this place had the best Thai food I've had in years! Highly recommend. We came here after a few other places were full but got super lucky. It's a little low key, not too packed and easily sat us during peak dinner hours. I'm honestly surprised it isn't more packed with the quality of food. Extremely flavorful with the right amount of spicy. I got the drunken noodles with chicken and those noodles were absolutely devine, perfectly cooked and just too good. The Thai iced tea was pretty standard but an excellent compliment to an otherwise fantastic meal. My friends felt the same way, I'd definitely come back. I wish I lived in SF so I could get this stuff more often. The menu states specific meats but like most Thai places they make it to cater to the customer. Don't be afraid, ask for spicy!
author: Rohit S.

description:
As we arrived in town late we were starving and didn't want to get out and drive losing our parking.  We ordered and got it very timely.  Everything was fresh and good.  Had tofu triangles-the sauce was a bit too runny and was just about the same suace we had with our curry- I guess I was expecting more than just bland fried tofu, they should cook it in a seasoning. 

 The roti (which was really Indian paratha) was very tasty, flaky and chewy!  The green veg curry was great.  I only thing I forgot to request was extra bowl as we were in a hotel and didnt have any dishes.  Totally recommend.  Thank you
author: Kimberly C.

description: My go to place!! I love their food!! Favorite dish is Green Curry Fried Rice. I had strayed and order from the Thai place down the street and was not impressed. IThai is the place!
author: Vika K.

description:
It's not the best in SF, but iDigress.

It's convenient that I can get other Asian options along with my Thai favorites. Their pad Thai is decent, their chicken satay nicely grilled (weird tasting peanut sauce though!) and my co worker liked her fish cake. We found the samosas to be too greasy and I didn't like that they charged $7 for 6 tiny rolls of vegetarian spring roll.

We got delivery through our order on eat24, was quoted 75 minutes, but got our meal in an hour. Horay for that.
author: Janice C.

description: I ordered from iThai five or six times in the last two months. They have a great selection of dishes that are gluten-free, my favorite being the Pad See-Ew! The fried rice is also very good. I live close by and have always had my food within 30 minutes. One of my favorite takeout restaurants in the city!
author: Lk P.

description: It was a double whammy. It was both the worst tasting and most expensive Thai delivery I've had in a long damn time.
author: Manuel H.

description:
I've never actually been to their physical location. My experience is just with delivery. My sleep schedule has been a bit wack lately and I don't eat dinner until after 12am. Good thing ithai is open until 1am and delivers! 

-1 star from previous review because they are not consistent with their food. The seafood noodles are what me and my sister usually get--they sometimes put clams in the dish, sometimes they don't. Sometimes they put green beans in the dish, sometimes they don't. I've gotten spiciness level mild, medium, and spicy before and they all taste the same. 

Overall, the food is good. Come here if you are not fussy about lots of oil (again, kind of inconsistent). The roti is also good but Sai Jai is cheaper.
author: Anna H.

description: Horrible delivery, always late. The last two deliveries I got the wrong food and when I called the asians employees only yell rather then to listen. I got double pineapple rice
author: Francisco M.

description:
The entree I got from this place was pretty great.

I ordered the kau pad gai tod for takeout which was fried chicken over fried rice with the special sauce (which by the way is just sweet and sour to my knowledge). The portions were satisfactory. It wasn't too small and it wasn't too overwhelming. The chicken wasn't too crispy like the traditional fried chicken that we know of in America. I would say that the order I got was tasty and would love to try other entrees from this place!
author: Aj C.

description: This restaurant must have changed owners within the past year. It use to be my fav Thai restaurant in SF but the food is just ok now as it's lacking flavour. There have been a 20% increase on the entire menu. The restaurant has a fountain located at the front and it is leaking on the floor so it smells like a wet towel. The staff is also incredibly rude.
author: Leanna B.

description: I placed a big order and more than half of the food was uncooked. A lot of the chicken was pink and gave us all food poisoning
author: Bhupinder B.

description: Omg this place is hella good. Im a big fan of thai food and i enjoy exploring sf when it comes to trying out different cuisine. Get the fried chicken for an appetizer. Strong garlic flavor. The pork belly with basil is pretty bomb too! Definitely coming back here.
author: Christian M.

description: These are the most amazing ppl from quality and customer service order here!!!! Plus for all the partiers they are open bella late!!!
author: Peter I.

description:
Great food. From he outside you'd think its a typical place that will be overpriced with bland and flavourless food. It's not! I ordered a pork meatball soup and fried fish over fried rice with garlic. Both dishes were delicious. The only thing I was disappointed about is that I specifically asked the waitress if a soup and a main dish were too much and she said no. I couldn't finish none of them as both were enormous (1-2 persons could eat from each one) But both were delicious and prices are very good.

I absolutely recommend it!
author: Ivo G.

description: Loved this place. The vibe was fun and light. The food was top notch and they accommodated my special diet needs. This is my second time here, my first was yesterday and I'll probably be back tomorrow. Aom helped me and was extremely nice. Don't hesitated to check this place out.
author: Camilo B.

description: Some of the best Pad See Ew I've ever had. I can see why iThai was so busy when I walked in. Took the food to go, but I might sit down and enjoy it more next time.
author: Jon N.

description:
Was really surprised by this Thai street food restaurant. Just passed by not knowing the place I thought I would give it a try. Went for the traditional favorite pad Thai. It was actually really good- had a mix of chicken and prawns. My friend had the duck curry. It was also really tasty and great value. 
The only downside is that it lacks atmosphere. But as cheap and cheerful places go, you can't do a lot better.
author: Derek M.

description:
This place is so close to my place but i did have a not-so-good experience with it one time eating with my friends. The rice was cold and the chicken was too chewy.
However, the menu at H.O.T is getting bored to me so I decided to give this place another try. 
Wow, iThai seafood noodle is the bomb. Perfectly spicy and great blend with other spices and seafood. I had extra squids i/o shrimps. So goooood.
Then, an average experience again when I ordered wonton noodle take out, noodle was undercooked and wontons were cold. *long sigh*
Tonight, after feeling fresh, I usually feel hungry. My favorite Korean restaurant closes early 'n I craved for something sweet and spicy and watery. Hence; I come back here. Guessing that pick out the icon dish such as Tomyum soup would never goes wrong. Indeed, it is not. So deliciousss. I tend to leave behind soups and only prefer meat, veggies and noodle, not the soup. But this time, I drank till it crank!!! Wonderful! My International Women's day completes with joy...
So I guess, with iThai, it is perhaps better to eat in rather than order or take out ;)
author: Bao V.

description: This place was recommended to me when I was staying nearby, but dare I eat at a restaurant with a near failing health score? I was feeling Adventurous and ordered pad kee mao And pad Thai. Both were very good above average and better than most I've had in San Francisco. My only hesitation is the health score. Thankfully I didn't get sick and enjoyed the food. 4/5. Above average Thai food, and I know my Thai. I would recommend it to anyone nearby. Recommend dining in over taking out tho.
author: Nick J.

description: Worst Thai food ever. Chicken was rotten had to send it back and waiter made us feel bad for it. Had a beer and left. Horrible horrible place. Don't go.
author: Jay N.

description: We liked it so well, we went twice.  Inexpensive for SF and the food is fantastic.  The restaurant wasn't super busy but they seem to do a lot of take out. Huge menu. The Kaprow Gai (chicken chili basil) was super good - very flavorful spice.  They have a space for live music it seemed.
author: Jennifer L.

description: I ordered the kao mun gai and the cucumber salad. The rice was over cooked and got some reason it's sweet. The chicken was full of fat and again SWEET.  The cucumber salad was for (surprise surprise) sweet, like it was soaked in simple sugar. None of these dishes are supposed to be sweet. It was a waste of my money I couldn't even eat it after few bites. Tasted more like dessert than entree.
author: Jasmine T.

description: Decided to try this place out since the deli next door was closed. To my surprise the food and service was great. The service was awesome, the gentleman was very attentive and nice. Food was great, don't knock it till you try. I ordered 1 app & 1 dish and totaled under $20.00.
author: Edie R.

description: Hmmm, what can I say. The place was kinda ok I guess. Food was average, service was poor, tables where kinda dirty. Smelled like sewage.  I attempt to go to the restroom, and turn right around and held it. That bathroom was filthier than a gas station  bathroom in the hood. So I held it in till we left and went elsewhere. 1 try wonder. That's it.
author: Julie J.

description: Delivery was quick, but they forgot the rice so the poor lady had to leave and come back. She was very nice about it. My issue was not with the service but the food. Yellow curry is always good but I also ordered pad Thai and it was greasy and spicy (I ordered not spicy), otherwise a good local delivery Thai place!
author: Meg W.

description:
Fresh spring rolls and green chicken curry were great. This place definitely beat out expectations, especially given its name. 

Spring rolls come with a light gluten free chili sauce. They also serve brown rice if you're into that.
author: Daina L.

description:
This place is pretty bomb. 

I ordered takeout from them for the first time, and the delivery was very fast which is always a plus! I ordered the Mussaman Nuer and the iThai Fried Rice. The portions were perfect - not too small but not too big. The Mussaman Nuer is one of the BEST curries I've ever had! The curry had somewhat of a peanut, coconut flavor to it, with braised shortrib and potatoes. The shortrib was so tender and just melts in your mouth! And the iThai Fried Rice had amazing flavors of onion, basil, and lime. I ordered both dishes medium spicy which was pretty spicy! So definitely keep that in mind when you're ordering how hot you want your dish to be. I loved both dishes and the pricing is very reasonable!

I will absolutely order from this place again! They really know how to add spice and Thai flavors to their food. It doesn't taste Americanized at all. Authentic flavors which is what I look for!
author: Chisholm T.

description: Bring earplugs. The food and service were alright. Having to suffer through the table behind us signing awful karaoke for 45 mins was not so pleasant.
author: Austin W.

description:
I like their Thai street food angle. The place is clean and welcoming. Presentation is important in Thai restaurants and it works here.

Menu: Usually, Thai restaurants feature more vegetarian options or ways to configure things to be vegetarian than IThai seems to. I appreciate it when the menu indicates which things can be made vegetarian. They worked with me nicely to find a dish.

Overall Experience: I came in for lunch, was seated right away, and had a fine time. The service was quick and the place was about 1/3 full. The food came hot and fresh. Feedback on the food- it's very flavorful and tasty. My noodle dish had very little tofu though. Also, overall the dish was so oily I could not eat the last 1/3. I usually say "low oil" but forgot. I think chefs just toss like 1/4 cup of oil per serving.

I'd go back, but would specify low oil and would take more time to read the menu to see what can be made vegetarian. Great, strong flavors and the spices are bold - thank you.
author: Roxmarie M.

description:
Tried it for lunch.The veggie spring rolls were fine. My wife's ground chicken and basil was way over-salted, and my vegetable noodle soup was boring, and largely bereft of vegetables other than napa cabbage. But to be fair, veg noodle soup is a bad bet in Thai restaurants, now that I think about it: it's always blah.

The waitress was glum and dowdy. The place didn't seem terribly clean--didn't smell great.

Unfair, I guess, to judge a place on three dishes, but we won't be back for further "research"; there are too many other good options in walking distance, even if one's focus is solely Thai food.
author: John H.

description:
First time reviewing in a loooooong time, but I feel that this little place deserves some love. 

I decided to try it out since the timeshare I'm at nearby offers a discount and I'm glad to say I wasn't dissapointed. Sure the wait time was long, but this SF and I know its tough to get around. But it only took 45 min and the food was piping hot and deeeeeelicious~

I will say that the hard boiled egg was a bit over cooked for my tastes and the lemongrass chicken wings a bit too sweet. But the 3 pork street plate was tasty and filling, though it could of used some veg. My bf had the thai fried rice with pork and he wasn't dissapointed. 

So overall if you're staying on the surrounding streets near iThai give it a try. Its not the most mindblowing food but its tasty on a budget.
author: Amber D.

description:
The service was weak, not busy but had to search out people to be seated, to order, etc
The bowls, table and floors were dirty. I mean the table was sticky like you had to work to free up a glass to take a sip. The bathroom floor was sticky-er.
The food when it came was lukewarm. The food itself was OK, but with all the other issues do yourself a solid and just go to Osha Thai a couple blocks away.
author: Eric T.

description:
Delivery was no bueno... or however you say that in Thai.

Each dish is at least $10 and for that ten buckaroos, you get about 6 bites. The containers are ridiculously small! My pad prik as well as panang curry came with the leftover pieces of roasted pork (you know, with the crispy skin.... The kind that people order as a FREAKING APPETIZER). Pad Thai was nothing special either... 

So there you have it. A two star review. Oh, and it took over an hour to get to us when we were within a two mile radius. I'll pass on ordering from here again.
author: Vi T.

description: I'm hungry and now upset. I made an order around 11:50pm so I understand it was late. The delivery driver calls me around 12:45am saying he can't find my location which I noted The Westin room 3194.. proceeds to say "this place doesn't have room 3194". I ask him if he's at the Westin and he continues to say that my room doesn't exist. I speak to the bell hop and they tell me that he can come through the back entrance if it's easier. The driver then tells me he will call me after his next delivery. It's now 1:00am, I'm starving, and I have a meeting early in the morning. I get a call back from the restaurant around 1:15am telling me that the driver was confused and it may be another 20 minutes..really? Never again iThai. Don't try to rip off of an Apple product name if you can't even deliver.
author: Brian K.

description:
My coworker and I didn't bring our lunches so we decided to order from the Eat24 app. I recommended iThai to him because I had a really good experience with you guys a few weeks back when I ordered a super late dinner and you guys delivered it within an hour. I was super happy with that.

But, when I ordered again, I was very disappointed. Yesterday, I ordered an entree and 2 appetizers for my coworker and I to share. Our delivery time was supposed to be 12:05pm. 

When 12:10pm rolled by I was getting anxious since I was raving about how great your delivery service was. I called iThai and the girl on the phone said that the driver left 30 minutes ago. I agreed to wait another few minutes. 12:25 rolls over and my coworker is questioning my recommendations. I call iThai again to ask what's going on. If my food left 30 minutes ago when I called at 12:10pm, that means my food has been on the road for almost an hour. :(!!

The girl on the phone said to please wait another few minutes. I was getting super impatient but agreed to wait another 5 minutes. 12:30pm rolls along and I decided to cancel my order. My lunch was 30minutes gone and I barely had time to eat. I called again and the girl on the phone asked me to please wait another 15 minutes?! My lunch would've been done by then and my food would probably be cold by then also. I explained that to her and told her to please cancel my order. After I refused to wait another 15 minutes, she mumbled that she will cancel my order and hung up on me.

I give you the benefit of the doubt that shit happens.. maybe hire more drivers?
author: Crystal L.

description:
I order iThai for delivery fairly often and have mixed feelings. They deliver late and they deliver far. This place has some awesome appetizers and good variety of street food! However the Pad Thai is mostly sprouts and dry. Not a lot of substance to it. Also, their curries do not come with rice, so be sure to remember to add it to delivery orders! The Thai tea is good and the delivery is fairly fast (foods are well-packaged for the trip).

I've never been to the brick-and-mortar iThai so I can't comment on that.
author: Irina P.

description: The prawns were so overlooked all that was left were the shells...I still can't believe they delivered such a mess. Very low end Thai option, Osha is a million times better.
author: David M.

description:
Food wasn't bad but would have a better idea if the rice was delivered with it.
Waited 1 hour and the food came without the white rice.
Wow.  Also Yelp - you need to learn from Uber.  After an order, you should have it automatically go to review.  But then I think you don't really want to hear the complaints
author: Jim S.

description: Ugh I've been here before and it was ok. Tonight however was just horrible! The food was so disgusting and old and stale, one bite and I lost my appetite instantly. The restrooms were filthy. They don't have their health score posted and didn't really think about it until I checked yelp and discovered they have 59!!! WHAT? How has this place not been shut down? Awful experience, awful food. Never coming back, hope I don't get sick. STAY AWAY!
author: paul b.

description:
2.8 Stars-which includes the friendly service! 

We wanted to go back to Brenda- but the line was probably too long so we decided to have some Thai food for Lunch..   We weren't sure if we wanted  iThai (3.5 stars on Yelp- 5/11/13) or ThaiStick (3.0 Stars on Yelp) ? So we went with the one that had the higher ratings.

FIRST!!  The decor and ambiance is completely WRONG!!  =)   I guess I watch too much HELL KITCHEN.. LOL.  Mr. Ramsey would probably wonder what is going on??    We weren't sure if we were really in a Thai Restaurant, the white decor and art was nice but I think the owner should have opened a French restaurant instead. Also, the loud background music sounds French.. Ok, I think the owner tries to make this place more upscale and fancy, yet I don't understand why there was a TV with the Warriors playing?   The owner should remove the TV, add some smoothing Thai music and art! 

NOW! Back to the food..  We came here during lunch time, so I thought we would have gotten a small Thai salad with an egg-roll or something.  Next, the food was nicely represented, yet the curry and rice looked rather lonely together. Overall, the curry was good but the favor wasn't strong enough for a WOW!!   Finally, my 3 kinds of pork over rice looked amazing yummy!!  However, the hard boiled egg was overcooked; Still, it tasted way better than the curry, yummy but not yummy enough for me to come back. .  Lastly, the thai tea was a bit sweet for me, but I did like it since it was free when you check in with YELP!!  Thanks YELP!!
author: Cindy C.

description: Getting off a 6hr flight, I was pretty hungry. We ordered 2 plates of different chicken, steak, pork, and garlic/white rice. We could not complain about one thing! Besides it being karaoke night, apparently? We couldn't hear ourselves, so decided just to enjoy the food and make the best of the entertainment.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
Being a regular customer at Chaaba, we wanted to try something different in the area. 
We ordered pad kee maao to gos. One veggie and the other with chicken. Must say, the veggies used in it were to our liking more than Chaaba. Not to forget the spices and the flavors.  We will definitely be a regular here now. Keep it up guys!
author: Neil S.

description: Ordered delivery. The jasmine rice I ordered was missing. Larb is pretty plain, but still acceptable. Pad Kaprao fried rice though was very bitter. Somehow some of the minced pork is burned too. I had a hard time finishing it.
author: Gott P.

description: Tom kah was very sweet, service was alright, atmosphere was terrible. I would never go back to this place and pay for it.
author: Marina M.

description:
Most of the food is really decent, especially for it's price. Great place to sit too!

I've actually eaten here over a hundred times. (Got a points card to back that up) and oh, I'm Thai, Straight out of Bangkok. 

As a Thai, food is a very big thing. We're pretty obsessed.
And this place is where the thais go around here.

I started going through their menu one by one, and I was blown away. I still haven't eaten them all. Because I liked some so much I just kept ordering it.


Here's some tips:

Their Giew Tod was extra crunchy, and goes pretty darn well with the noodles.
Talking about noodles, the soup of their Guai jub was a very pleasant surprise of rolled noodles with crunchy pork bits, and their Kao Soi is great if you want a taste of curry on your noodles. It's a dish famous in the northern parts of Thailand.

I love their Ka moo, It's juicy pork leg on sauced rice. (you can probably ask them for more or less fat pieces if you prefer) It's also a good indication that their "Kao na ped" will taste pretty good.

Kao mun gai, It's chicken with flavored rice. It's the thai street food we grew up with. This and the Pad Krapaos are the "I don't know what to eat" standard dishes.

Hungry and need something fast? Their pad see ew moo gets done, It's practically our fast food dish. it's lightly seared soft noodles flavoured with sauce and pork.

I really like their pork lately, It's not dry like many other places, So I'd recommend their pork fried rice, too

For less "usual" things, Their pla duk fu is crunchy and classier than most of the pla duk fus i had.
And if you want beef, Their Sur rong hai is tasty as heck. It's like steak, but less oily and more aroma. Yes, I should end with their Sur rong hai.
author: Sra P.

description:
One of the best Thai food I have ever had the pleasure to eat.
The food size portions are massive and the staff were incredibly friendly.
author: Mark C.

description:
Not sure what to think of this place.

Egg rolls and spring rolls were good, though pretty small portions.Tom Kha Gai soup was flavorful and chock-full of goodies, came in a pretty big sterno-fueled pot too. Kao Pad Kark Moo (pork belly fried rice) was quite good, and a little mountain came on the plate. The Pla-Duk Pad Phed (catfish) was spicy as indicated but not crispy and half the portion of everyone else's dishes. Bummer, because that was mine.

It's a weird techy apple theme/decor. Pretty drafty, which definitely doesn't help on chilly SF nights. Waitresses were attentive but whenever they asked "Is everything okay?" it sounded like there WAS something wrong and they were waiting for us to find it.
author: Vivian H.

description: Great curry, but delivery gave me NO rice with my curry. Both my best friend and I ate straight curry...riceless. It was a depressing night.
author: Angela Y.

description: I almost passed this by because of the overall rating but I'm glad I didn't! It was very good, affordable and great atmosphere. If you want an authentic Thai experience like in Thailand, I recommend iThai.
author: Jay G.

description: The best late night Thai I've had in downtown. Delivery time is spot on to the estimated and customer service I received was exceptional. Definitely favoriting this spot!
author: Brady W.

description: Coming into sf in the late night hungry but tired at the same time having the food delivered was the most ideal. The food was delivered before the expected delivery time which was awesome the food purchased was good as well. Only downfall was no utensils or napkins were given when in the directions we said to leave it at hotel reception for our room number. Maybe it was so late they forgot? Kind of annoying thought when you're ready to eat your food but you can't you have to wait longer to get some silverware from room service
author: Evanie W.

description: So, I finally decided to try it.  We sat at 9:15pm and they were really nice but, it took a while for them to take our order ( there was maybe 6 tables and a lot of to go orders lined up for UberEats).  When they did take our order, we got our drinks right away.  The egg roll appetizer came at 9:40.  The problem came when I asked at 10:15pm if the food was coming.  The first girl said she would check but never came back to us to give a reply.  So at 10:20 when we got the wings we ordered, I asked the guy who brought it out about the rest of our food.  He went to the back and didn't return without the food. At 10:30pm, we received the fried rice that we were anxious for.  It was horrible.  The rice was cooked with too much water so it had a oatmeal consistency and there was no seasoning at all.  Not sure what happened tonight but, we paid quickly and left. They didn't charge us for the rice but, we certainly were not happy to have wasted so much time waiting for that!  Wrote this review while waiting on our pizza because we are still starving and it's all that is open at this point.
author: J M.

description: Had the soft spring rolls (not the fried version), and it was just weird. They cut it into six small pieces, and the filling would come out when you pick it up. The sauce that came with it was overly sweet. Missed the peanut sauce. The filling was not shrimp or chicken but some mystery meat or perhaps tofu. Hopefully their other dishes are a bit better. Won't be ordering spring rolls from here anytime soon.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Food here is delicious!

For the appetizer, I recommend their Gai Satay.
For the main dish, I recommend their Kao Pad Gai Tod, Kang Karre Gai, Mussaman Nuer, Sur Rong Hai and Tom Yum Seafood Soup.
For the drink, I recommend their Thai Iced tea.

It's a great restaurant with a reasonable price.
author: Davis L.

description:
I got some food delivered last night to my hotel and- holy hell- it was FANTASTIC. SO good. 
I haven't had Thai food in a while and I've been craving it and I got the perfect meal. Only $20 for mixed veggies (perfectly cooked), egg rolls and Kao Mun Gai Tod. It was a crusted piece of chicken over some white rice. And it all came with some sweet and spicy chili sauce. I was in heaven. The delivery was quicker than expected (40ish minutes). 

The best part was that they knew what they were doing in delivery. My chicken was breaded and usually when you get delivery on a breaded item, the steam get trapped and makes everything soggy. But their genius idea was to cut a hole in the top of the cover and it was perfect! My chicken was still crispy and delicious. Props

Seriously I'm in love and will probably order from here again maybe tonight, and definitely next time I'm in San Francisco!!
author: Jessica S.

description:
Filipinos, come eat here. Startup workers and post-hipsters, come eat here. Ghost of Steve Jobs, come eat here. This place certainly has the "i" part down, with the brushed aluminum on white themed interior and OS X window buttons on the menu. The music is largely straight-up club, and there's a curtained stage at the back as a hint of the future of this establishment. Bring your air guitar.

The menu has items you've seen at other Thai places. Two sections that may have surprises for you are "Something Specials" and "I'm Adventurous". Turns out that being adventurous means being Filipino, with regard to the chicharrón fried rice and the bagook x green mango dishes. At least, those were the images that came to mind when reading over the descriptions for "Kao Pad Kark Moo" ("Ultimate iThai fried rice with crispy pork skin, carrots, onions, and egg") and "Kao Klook Gapi" ("Shrimp paste rice with side of sour mango, sweet pork, egg strips, sun dried shrimps").

The KPKM pork skin was less rind and more skin + fat layer + meat, kind of like bacon's older brother who happens to play varsity football. Cucumber slices garnished the plate, but the carrots, onions, and egg were absent. Since we'd only ordered this dish to try the pork skin, perhaps it's better that no other ingredients got in the way.

The KKG shrimp paste, nam plik, was a subtler and less salty version of bagook with the tiny shrimps ground up. Rather than a tongue assault like Korean saeujeot (which primarily isn't intended as a condiment anyway), the nam plik was dippable, spreadable, and overall more approachable as a table item. The sour mango was pickled, which was a new concept to me - I thought it would be green (unripe) mango.

We also had "Keaw Wan Roti" for some Indian influence, and its curry unexpectedly included makla (likely incorrect spelling), a small and round Thai eggplant.

Rounding out our set was a carafe of "Cloudy in Bangkok", similar to Korean yogurt soju. Ordering the carafe instead of a glass seemed like a good move because the contents were somehow just enough for the accompanying cocktail-sized cup. But how big would the glass have been? If the glass would've been similar to the cup, we shouldn't have opted for the carafe at twice the price. You may want to ask to see the vessels before making your choice.

Our meal was interesting and our servers were friendly. Oddly enough though, for being named "iThai", there weren't a bunch of outlets for plugging in MacBooks to work while eating. All in all, this is one of those places that I want to rate well because I liked it but want to rate poorly so it won't be popular and overcrowded next time we go. I can picture it filling up with Academy of Art students.
author: Dan B.

description: Got here at 12:17 am. Yelp stated it was open until 1am. The told us kitchen was closed at 12:30. We informed them it was not 12:30 yet and that we took a 25.00 cab ride over and yelp stated they were open until 1. They said kitchen closed already. Wasted time and money.
author: Sarah L.

description:
The food is alright but I will definitely try some other things. I got the pork and eggplant and it was pretty good, but I've had better. 

The staff wasn't very attentive... But a super fun vibe! I have never been to a place that had Thai Karaoke! It was really fun to watch!
author: Kathleen T.

description: We happened upon this place on a Sunday evening. The food came out glistening and piping hot. I have bee to much fancier Thai restaurants  and this food was better and more original.
author: Lisa T.

description:
We usually order from eat24 so I don't know much about their customer service and restaurant. What I do know is.. they are one of my fave thai food to go :) 

Kao Mun Gai Tod: Crispy fried chicken over garlic rice with sweet chili sauce
- The garlic rice itself has this authentic Hainanese chicken taste. I'd definitely order this when I have cravings for hainanese chicken cause it's the closest taste to the one I had in Singapore. 
-Crispy chicken could be a little more tender but its ok since its always crispy when it arrives.

Crab Curry: Yellow curry with crab.
Mmm because its creamy for sure! Its a little sweet but not bad. I love how they add egg. They add a reasonable amount of crab. A hint of spicy would make it more awesome! 

Pad See-Ew Moo: Pan fried white noodle with thai black bean sauce. A pretty perfect balance between noodles, chinese broccolli, egg and pork. Its very flavorful but it does get a little salty after awhile but still really good! 

Kha Soi: Red curry with marinated meat. 
Beef or chicken? I say chicken cause the beef is not as tender and a little too chewy for me. The noodle and crispy noodle is really delish! I'd rather eat this with rice than actually eat it like soup because the curry acts more of a gravy. 

Last but not least you can never go wrong with thai ice tea :) 

As long as they're nice when they deliver and they don't take more than an hour for delivery then yes I'll mos def order here again! Plus I want to try their Kao Mun Gai (steamed chicken over garlic+ginger rice) next time...
author: Sharmaine M.

description: Ordered on yelp 24.  It worked good. The Tom Yum coconut soup didn't have any coconut milk. The potatoes in the yellow curry weren't cooked. The coconut ice cream I ordered was good. I would order the ice cream again, but nothing else.
author: John S.

description: Very disappointed. I ordered here because of the unusual range of appetizers. I was hungover and wanted something fried I could eat with my hands. I'm not sure whether the oil wasn't hot enough or maybe the food had been in the car for too long but everything was greasy to the point of being inedible. I tried to soak the oil off with kitchen paper and it still wasn't really edible. We tried most things but threw away a large portion of the food - it sounds like if you want to go to this place you need to go in person.
author: Amaya B.

description:
Ok we want to love this place and we would have given it a perfect 5 star if it wasn't for the issue with delivery of food. We order here 3 times and every time the driver doesn't know where the location is or the restaurant have not receive the food order. 

When we call seamless they say someone from the restaurant confirm the night before and they still manage to not have the order. I don't understand. We just want our Khao Soy to deliver to our office within the time frame requested...which is not too much to ask since we are in Fidi and they are in lower nob.
author: Swwtnsour T.

description: Delicious seafood fried rice, full of flavor. Their mild curry is decent as well as their beef. Service is average. Don't know much about the rest of their dishes
author: Sui N.

description: I ordered a delivery of Pad Thai and Friend Rice. The food too 2 hours to arrive, was pretty cold, and very mediocre. Pretty disappointing.
author: Tom A.

description: I THAI took my money and literally failed to deliver! After waiting two hours, I called I Thai and they scurried around only to say they couldn't find my order. Well, they sure did find my bank account. Furious. I better see the refund back in my account as quickly as they took it! Stay away from this shady robber!
author: Lisa H.

description: Just got into town and tried to find a place that was open between lunch and dinner. We were glad we found this place. Quick service. Competent Thai food with nice presentation and attentive service.
author: Keith C.

description: Want to wait 2.5 hours for delivery? For mediocre Thai food? By all means, call iThai!!
author: Christine M.

description: i really like thai food，soup is good. But I like the Pakapow(I don't know what to spell it) it's chicken or pork fried with some chill.it my favourite
author: Tong K.

description:
Food was fantastic! I had the iThai Seafood Noodles and the egg rolls. The noodles I would order in again in a heart beat, probably not the egg rolls (not because they weren't good, just nothing exceptional).

 The servers were incredibly polite and friendly however a tad on the slow side.
author: Megan B.

description:
Amazing food and huge portions. Very well priced! I have been here for 3 days and this is the best meal yet! Great service and clean beautiful restaurant. I suggest the yellow chicken curry and the chicken sauté with peanut sauce. + rice ofcourse. 

Thai tea and Thai coffee as well!!

Thanks ithai! We will be back!
author: Kass M.

description: We ordered the crispy egg rolls, kang karee, and kao pad kark moo for delivery. We waited 1 hr and 40 mins and the food arrived luke warm and the egg rolls were no longer crunchy. I was very disappointed that the curry didn't come with rice. I guess I had to order that extra? With that said, it was really good food. I may stop in if in the neighborhood but would not get delivery again.
author: Laura S.

description:
DO yourself a favor and eat here. NOW!  We order from Grubhub all the time and we have always been happy with anything we have ever gotten from this place but this one item takes the win: Prik Khing Moo Grob (String Beans)
what it is : Sauteed crispy pork belly with string beans in red 'prik khing' curry paste.  Add some Jasmine Rice and your mouth will be thanking you! 

We are obsessed with this dish! Completely 100% obsessed!  Cant get enough. The pork Belly is cripsy in all the right places. Even with the amount of sauce the pork belly keeps its crisp. The string beans have just enough crunch. The sauce has enough kick but it wont over power your taste buds. Ahhhhh..... gimme gimme gimmeeee!
author: Krishna M.

description: My husband and I both ordered the Chicken Pad Thai. It was good & different from the pad Thai we are used to. Overall, a nice little spot for dinner. I think I would have just enjoyed better service, I felt like I had to ask for everything. A tea refill, twice, sugar for my tea (& she brought me one packet). Slow service with just us and an another couple in the restaurant. Started getting filled at around 8:30.
author: Abigail P.

description:
...the fact that their menus are paper ipads -_______-

...the fact that the waiter displayed the dessert menu on an actual ipad  -______-

...the fact that they have fold-out church chairs

...the fact that they forgot my thai iced tea

*sigh*

Found this place on scoutmob and decided to check it out since I was in the neighborhood. I was kind of annoyed that it was like an indoor picnic-style. My friend got the spicy eggplant and I got the chicken. We had the fried banana or fried coconut ice cream for dessert...my experience was so unmemorable, cant even recall which we had for dessert. :/

Won't be back.
author: Lydia L.

description:
I decided to try iThai again a couple of weeks ago after not eating here for several months.  When I stopped coming here, renovations to the places had recently started and the quality of many of the dishes had gone down to my disappointment.

I told myself that I would eventually come back to see if the quality improves, especially since there were a few items that either they offered only, or did better than other Thai restaurants.

I've been here about 5 times in the past 2 weeks trying (again) some of the dishes I was found of here.  The verdict?  Quality has much improved.

One of the first things I ordered was Kao Mok Gai (Herbed chicken with curried rice). The flavor was about as good as I remembered it should be, the only difference is the chicken is boneless now, which I'm a little bummed about since I like gnawing on the grizzle on the bone (must be the Asian in me).  I see few other Thai restaurants serving this dish as well.

Second visit was Yum Pla Dook Foo (Crispy catfish salad).  Nothing wrong here. Good vegetable to fish ratio, fried fish didn't get soggy quickly, and seasoning was great, though I could have gone spicier.

Also, ordered was Gui Chai (fried chive dumplings). This dish has always been good. It doesn't taste like it's burnt or been cooked in old oil like some other places.

Third visit was Kao Pad Moo Kark (Fried rice with crispy pork skin). This was one of the dishes I initially liked most because the only other place that I've had it is in Thailand.  It's actually a pretty simple dish; well seasoned fried rice with crispy pork skin... and some pork belly.  Mind you, the emphasis on this dish should be on pork skin, not pork meat.  And really no one should be complaining that they got served only pork skin.

The dish was almost as good as when I first ordered it here.  My main complaint is the rice was a bit on the greasy side, even for a dish that is basically fried pork skin and fried pork fat.

My latest visit here, I had Koh Moo Yang (pork shoulder w/ tamarind sauce).  Nothing necessarily wrong with this dish, I just wasn't very impressed with it. Perhaps, I just wasn't in the mood for this dish like I thought.  The pork had good flavor and was tender.  The tamarind sauce was a bit sweeter than I expected and not as spicy as expected either. Maybe that's why I'm indifferent toward this dish. Anyhow, not a bad dish, just not my dish (at least not on that night).

Other thoughts?
The makeover is nice.  The chairs are much nicer and more comfortable.  Some items have been removed from the menu, like Bamee Jup Kang (an egg noodle soup with pork), which I'm disappointed about.

Overall, I'll probably continuing coming back here (again).  And they still have late night karaoke, and a live band on Fridays which is another thing I like.
author: Dennis Z.

description:
Very bad experience.

I ordered the pork belly in basil and it was very bad. The pork was so TOUGH. It was too spicy.

The Chicken Wings was too sweet and sticky.

The service was slow and the atmosphere was loud.
author: Leslie M.

description:
Great environment. I love that they stay open to so late. The food was good. The pricing is great! And it's so close to my apartment. 
They took long to take my order. I didn't mind, but still. And they never brought me my water. :) 
I'll be back though.
author: OH B.

description: The only good thing i can say is that the delivery showed up earlier than expected. Other than that, the entire order was luke warm and the driver was pretty rude. The pad thai noodles were pretty bad and half the tray was filled with sprouts, so it felt like we got half and order. Why were there tomatoes in the tom yum soup? Never seen that before, plus it was super watery so that wasn't nice. Will not recommend or order again.
author: Jason K.

description:
We love this neighborhood find introduced to us by my bf's friend Barry!  We went here for dinner last night and then again for lunch today because we were immediately hooked.  

What we tried so far:
* Jessy's Noodles (fat noodles, ground pork, vegetables - mmm, love, no wonder Jessy loves this so much, wonderful taste, I would order this again and again)
* Tom Yung Kiang seafood soup with noodles (tasty, comforting, perfect for SF weather, seafood: shrimp, calamari, clams, were all so tender and perfectly cooked)
* Crab fried rice (lovely crab on top and mixed through, love, filling, yumm)
* Spicy eggplant (hits the spot, can be made medium or hot hot spicy)
* Pumpkin curry (nice flavor, love the pumpkin, tender, nicely cooked)
* Thai iced tea and iced coffee (both classically tasty, creamy, mmmm)

Service was friendly and courteous.  We will definitely be back again and again.  iThai rocks!
author: Maile N.

description: Had the Kao Moo Dang "street food" dish. It is a mix of three different kinds of pork over rice with a sweet sauce and a boiled egg. Very different from the usual Thai dishes which are starting to get a bit standardized and sanitized in the USA.  My dish was not very spicy, which diverges from the typical Thai hotness. It was still nicely seasoned with a definite Thai taste that I love.
author: Michael P.

description:
My favorite Thai in the city, easily.

Things I love: larb salad, Prik Khing (I always order it with pork not pork belly-- it's AMAZING), Moo Dad Deaw (LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE).. and everything else. Everything I've had is delicious, but several of them are so good that it's almost impossible to not order them.

I'm nowhere near them but now am trying to fight the urge to go all the way to there just to eat some Moo Dad Deaw and Prik Khing.

LOVE! Don't be scared by the overly big menu. Maybe just check it out before you go? 

The owner and staff are all super nice too.
author: Lisa N.

description: Great food in a good price. They also have unique menu that other thai restaurant do not have. Will definitely keep ordering!
author: Alvin Z.

description: The atmosphere was very relaxing. The food did not take long and the taste was acceptable. I did not have one of their recommended item but definitely give this place a try. It has a very extended menu, so you'll most likely find something that you like.
author: Kumpol H.

description: First time trying iThai ordered delivery since it is open til late. 2 hrs later no food tried to call the restaurant several times for a update but busy tone every time. Will never order here again.
author: Jasmeen G.

description: For delivery, the order took longer than predicted (not a huge deal).  The food was mediocre at best although.  I have lower expectations with delivery, so I ordered very common items (pad thai, Kang Keaw Wan Gai, Lemongrass Chicken) that I hoped wouldn't be hard to meet average standards.  I couldn't finish the pad thai and the Kang Keaw Wan Gai was oily and lacking.  Maybe dining in and ordering other items are much better, but I'd much rather go to better Thai restaurants.
author: Lanes S.

description:
second time I was pick up. I don't like cashier here, she never smile to customer. bad service because I complain first time so I called to her why don't put spoons together. she was mad and said bad sound with me. 

....................

first time
I ordered delivery foods with rice but just put only 2 forks!!! no spoon. order white rice but no spoon!!!. use hand ???
author: Warin Y.

description:
Be careful when ordering your level of spice here. We asked for medium with a calamari salad and got HOT, HOT, HOT! Like, indigestion-inducing hot. 

I was pretty non-plussed with the food at iThai, especially considering all of the other awesome Thai joints in the area. It's a little expensive and portions aren't very big. 

P.S. When is Apple going to sue them for naming rights?
author: Abby S.

description:
I really really really wanted Thai food that night. Just so happens that Scoutmob had a deal with iThai -- so I went to check it out

My friend had gotten the pineapple fried rice, and me -- I just needed me some pad thai (and it's the staple food to get when you want to test out the food at a Thai place). I was thoroughly disappointed.

It was SUPER oily. Like SUPER DUPER oily -- which made me pretty full after a few bites. I was pretty disappointed.
author: Joanne W.

description: One of the better Thai restaurants in the area. Beautiful restaurant with authentic Thai cuisine.  You know this is an authentic Thai cuisine when the majority of the patrons are Asian...eat here. It is a cool place.
author: David S.

description: I got the Kang Karee Gai for delivery. It was spicy, had NO flavor and the chicken tasted bad and was full of gristle and the potatoes weren't fully cooked.
author: Nicolas W.

description: Really amazing street Thai food! The fried rice and pad see ew were amazing...and the staff was super friendly and attentive. Def check it out if you're in town!
author: Maryah B.

description: Delivery was so terrible. Ordered over the phone and had to call twice for the cashier to get the correct phone. Are you fucking kidding me?!? This is a joke. My two orders were bland. Not ordering nor coming here anymore. Bad experience. Waste of my time and money.
author: J Phoenix B.

description:
If you want a nice and quiet place to dine in, this is not the place ! They have Thai karaoke and volume is full blast !! No you cannot converse with people in your table due to the noise. 
Food is okay. Everything is spicy let them know how spicy you want your food. 
I'm mainly yelping about the noise!! Loud karaoke !!
author: Kai V.

description:
I'm giving it 5 stars because the flavors of my spicy basil chicken and HB Steph's green curry rice were truly outstanding. It was delicious. They have something called garlic rice, and I'm intrigued for next time. 

The place feels like you've walked into a K-Pop cube. An understated K-Pop cube, if that is even possible, because Thai isn't Korean. Weird accent lighting- things are super super white, too. Its just odd.

Min $15 for free delivery between 5-10pm and I will be making some calls for this during finals for sure.
author: Emily D.

description: I had the Phad Thai. Not only did they get the order wrong - they kept my credit card. I would avoid this restaurant at all costs.
author: Joseph W.

description:
(See pics) Review #1139. While the sauce and food seemed to be different (and looked more authentic), the overall taste was just okay.

Duck salad (larb ped) was a bit salty but with a good number of duck bites. The steamed chicken was with good sauce but the chicken itself was bland and dry. It's really not difficult to make a tasty chicken and this one needed some seasoning.

The decoration is very modern and with very white tables and chairs. The door looked like one of those bar heavy ones.

With the extensive menu I will have to come back and hope for other better dishes.
author: T L.

description:
I think not. We ordered delivery: shrimp pad thai, green curry w/ brown rice, and basil chicken.

The shrimp in the pad thai was seriously over cooked and fishy. The brown rice was over a day old or something. It was hard and  dry like the bottom of a rice pot that had been sitting out overnight.

One star because they were open on 4th of July when no one else was.
author: Becca L.

description: Love the crispy pork belly texture. It's crunchy, sticky, mushy, and meaty all at once. Try it with the basil and peppers!
author: Kyle T.

description: Best taste thai restaurant in sf, but worst service ever too. Waitresses never smile, bad service, gossip costumers all the time, never ask for more water or anything else ok or not. Whatever, If u don't care about service, foods are very good, but how can i give 15% tip for service like this almost everyday. They always blame less tip's costumers, but they forgot to think about themselves...
author: Visarnpong C.

description: Came here on a rainy Friday by myself to eat a quick meal before heading out to meet friends at a nearby bar. The waiters are friendly and the restaurant is quiet and pleasant. Prices seem pretty reasonable too. I ordered the Pad See Moo, and the first bite was great, but soon realized it was way too salty. I had to order a side of rice just to finish it. And afterwards my mouth still felt a salty after taste from the dish.
author: Jon C.

description: If I could give them no star, I would . Ordered for delivery at 11:30 pm, and was told that food would be delivered within 45 minutes. Although I was hungry, I waited patiently , food didn't come within 45 minutes, and I called back @ 1am, the lady answered the phone told me that the driver was on his way, I waited patiently again, because it was only a 5 minute drive. The deliver guy never showed up, and I didn't get any call neither! this is ridiculous , I will never order from this place again !
author: Jon L.

description: I with my wife really like this place. Food is very tasty. The atmosphere  is relaxed and cozy. Romantic music, good stuff, great food and the prices are average (for example: 12$ for noodle or rice with seafood) - for me it's the best Thai restaurant in SF Downtown :)
author: Ilia S.

description: My friends and I were planning to go to osha Thai but for some reason they were closed so out of desperation we looked for another place close-by.     At first we were hesitant to try iThai because it sounded like an Internet cafe but we were desperate. We were happy that we gave this place a shot because it really impressed us. Everyone was happy with their dishes. The portion sizes seemed fine. The ambiance is a little dark so it feels intimate, for some reason it reminds me  of the rainforest cafe. Overall I like this food and atmosphere.
author: Serina J.

description: I really love this place.  I usually get the spicy basil clams but pretty much anything you get, you can't really go wrong.  The more than stellar staff is super friendly and very attentive, I never have to ask for anything.  But the true star of the show, the winner, is the food.  I'm always happy to be around the area because I know I'll be stoping in here for a delicious meal.  I truly recommend iThai to anyone who wants to fulfill their Thai food craving.
author: Christian H.

description:
iThai suffers from being the new kid in a neighborhood, with a confused concept and a dozen or two other Thai restaurants in the neighborhood.

First the food, which is the standout. All of the dishes I've had here had decent ingredients and were well prepared, with a complexity and depth of flavor two notches above a basic neighborhood Thai spot: the sauces were not sweet or gloppy, the noodles not overcooked, the seafood tasted fresher, and lots of stuff had a good sear on it and was prepped by somebody who knows how to use a knife. The menu is extensive and varied, not just the usual stuff: a whole large wok-fried squid, pork shoulder salad, beef stew with tamarind broth, interesting stuff.

Although priced at or lower the more popular places nearby, with better food, it's not as busy as it should be, I guess they haven't got the message across yet. The name and sleek-ish decor are on obvious homage to Apple, I think they're trying unsuccessfully to appeal to a young urban crowd.
