But then there's a stage in the back, little used, that seems setup for karaoke or something. A few months ago they wisely took all the English names off the menu, painful attempts to be cute, and replaced them with proper Thai names. Whatever it is, it's not unpleasant but I'm just not feeling it. Oh well, they're friendly, the price is right, and the food is very tasty, that's enough for me.
author: Gil S.

description: I was in search of anything that wasn't a burger place for dinner one rainy evening. This restaurant was near the hostel I was staying at, so I walked in after trekking around in the rain for somewhere to eat, preferably something savory. I asked the hostess if there was room for me, one person. From what I saw, it was hopping but not packed like sardines. She said yes and took me to an empty table. I sat down and waited for a server to come over to ask what I wanted to drink. A couple of minutes went by and nothing, so I pulled out my phone to entertain myself until somebody came over. Five to ten minutes later, nobody came over to my area, so I left. This was one of the worst customer service experiences that I had.
author: Gloria A.

description:
DO NOT ORDER DELIVERY FROM HERE
This is the second time that I ordered from iThai for my office. The delivery guy was AWEFUL. He was late 1st off. Then he was rude on top of that. When asked not to set the hot food on our conference room table he proceeded to unpack our food by slamming each dish down as he took it out of the delivery box telling us he "doesn't have time". When we asked for our receipt the driver stalked off towards the door not saying a word. 
When we called to complain & request our tip back they made excuses saying he was upset having to double park. News flash: ITS THE FINANCIAL DISTRICT. THERE IS NO PARKING! They should know this because they're restaurant is near us. 
The so called manager kept making excuses when we demanded our tip back. Like the fact that he had to double park was reason enough to be rude to us the customer. We didn't build downtown San Francisco. It's not our fault that parking is scarce. 
Now though out all of this, the food was really good. But I will never order from there again for my office. The good food is NOT worth dealing with the shitty delivery. And this is San Francisco. There are a million other Thai places to order from.
author: Leigh M.

description:
Never knew this gem existed in the Tenderloin area. We ordered the Crab Fried Rice, Pad See Ew noodles, Pumpkin Curry with tofu, Pad Thai, and a fried rice dish that had bits of dried fried pork in it. Everything tasted delicious and flavorful. Our host did a great job recommending dishes to us and also explained the cooking process for us. The place is new so it's very clean, comfortable and sleek. Feels a bit like a club atmosphere where the music was quite today's latest. 

The best part was the dessert consisting of deep fried rotti prata w/ coconut ice cream and caramel. Mouthwatering, finger licking good!
author: Corie Z.

description: I waited nearly two hours for delivery. Totally unacceptable, especially when this place is only a few blocks from my apartment, which is why I ordered from them. The driver texted me his location (after I called to complain) and he was strangely all the way on the other side of town. Needless to say, the food was cold. :-(
author: Adrian R.

description: Was here on Saturday night and had the spicy basil chicken, tom ka (mmmmm), larb, beef fried rice, and a couple other dishes . Deliciousness, great flavors. They also have beer towers which came in handy to cool down our mouths because our food was spicy!
author: Ms. M.

description:
If an apple store met a Thai restaurant this restaurant would be it.

The food was excellent and the decor was very modern nouveau.

The only thing I didn't Like on the menu was the Curry puffs appetizers. It appeared as if they had been previously fried and then fried again for us.  The curry chicken was not flavorful.  

We also had the yellow curry chicken main course which was excellent and the pad Thai noodles which were adequate. The larb salad was mostly meat and very little salad.  It was spicy and crunchy.  It would easily fit for a main  course.  

Overall, the experience was excellent, the food was excellent, and the ambience was clinically excellent.  I would do it again.
author: Steve M.

description:
Absolutely amazing! Probably my forever favorite Thai restaurant for a hearty and quality meal.

Came here with a friend and was blown away by the menu items. They had Thai street food that I don't think you could find anywhere else, made like that! For example, hoi tod, which is almost like a fried mussels pancake that you drench in this sweet, spicy sauce. Just thinking about it makes my mouth drool a little..

We ordered, I think, a bit too much but food this good can be my leftovers any day!

A definite recommendation to anyone. I'll for sure be back soon.
author: Christine N.

description:
I ordered dinner thru eat24hours.com for my boyfriend and had it delivered at his office last night.

Ordering online is very easy and convenient.

Why 2 stars? 

I ordered Kao Mun Gai tod which was described as crispy fried chicken in a bed of GARLIC rice (my bf loves garlic rice thats why i ordered this!)

What we got? Was a dried overcooked chicken breast, not all crunchy nor crispy. And it came with steamed rice ??!!! What happened to the garlic rice?

I also ordered Kao Pad Kark Moo which was apparently one of their best sellers and it says you'd be "hooked up" once u tried it.... It was okay. Nothing special about it

The two stars are for the Karprow Nuer Special which was delightfully flavorful and beef was tender! It is definitely something anyone will enjoy!

Very disappointed with the chicken n garlic rice ... Cant get over it!
author: Batchie B.

description:
LOVE this place. 

I've only ever ordered delivery (many many times) but the location looks nice whenever I drive by. Great food, quick delivery (usually in about 45 min), great prices. Nice, friendly delivery people. I've ordered a good portion of the menu. Some of my favorites are the spicy basil chicken, pumpkin curry, choo chee salmon, kao mun gai, spicy eggplant and pad see ew with chicken. The thai chicken soup is great too for cold days.

New favorite delivery place!!
author: Amy G.

description: Prompt delivery, tasty, good price.
author: Mr And Mrs S.

description:
Love this place!
However expect no parking! 

I never reviewed places before, but this one deserves a review. So I live in San Jose, and the first time my cousins and I came here, it was just a place we stumbled upon. At first we were headed towards Farm Table, a small and very expensive (although very good) cafe just a couple doors up Post St., but for being a little too expensive for a small portion, some of us didn't buy anything and some did but were still hungry after. So we decided to go to iThai. That was all it took for us to like this place.....


So yesterday, our whole family decided to go to SF and to see if this place was really a good and consistent place, we decided to go here again. Parking of course was nonexistent and eventually found some 2 blocks up Post. Anyway, this is what we ordered (well what I tried anyway): 

-spicy basil chicken: I order this one, I asked for medium spicy & sub minced meat for pieces of meat. This was by far one of the most delicious basil chicken dishes I have had. The chicken was tender, the sauce was delicious, the peppers were cooked very well. The only downside is that it wasn't medium hot in which I had to add more chili.

-tom yum chicken w/o coconut meat: I also ordered this one, which I asked for medium spicy as well. Again it wasn't medium spicy or spicy at all, but it was very delicious. It wasn't too sweet or too tart. I've had better but this came really close. 

-papaya salad: First off, I never liked papaya salad, but this one changed me. Very good. 

-Pad Thai thai hot: my mom got this one and she said it wasn't at all thai hot, which she then added loads of chili. She said it was too sweet, and that it had too much fish sauce in it, but was good. 

-Pad Kee Mao: This one was good. The bell peppers were really soft and tender, the basil made the dish. 

-Kao Mun Gai: The rice was very good. 

Overall a very excellent thai place. The spicy levels needs work, but I definitely recommend trying this place if you ever go to SF and are tired of the same pier 39 foods. :) 

P.S You should come to San Jose! We need a good Thai place! You would have a regular. :D
author: Jennifer G.

description: Ordered delivery from here. Food was bland and awful. Not recommended. Ar Roi is MUCH better.
author: Michael D.

description:
They have incredibly delicious food for the money.  The fried chicken over garlic rice is delectable, and they mix all their sauces very well.

Could almost have 5 stars, but the delivery guys take getting lost in the building to an art form.  It's like they get off at every floor and hope that's the one.
author: Adam S.

description:
The food is good, though portions are a little small. However, presentation is good, and flavors are fantastic, unless you don't like coconut. They use coconut cream in a lot of their dishes. I'm not the biggest fan, but I thought it tasted ok. 
This was a great little find.
author: Karen C.

description:
The place was empty Saturday afternoon and we stopped here because our first choice was closed, and we thought 3.5 stars was a decent rating.

We were wrong. 

After being seated, our party of five was served partially filled, dirty glasses of room-temperature water. You read right, the glasses were dirty. Starving and unfamiliar with the restaurants in the area, and parking meter ticking, we opted to put our disgust aside and hope for good food.

While waiting for food I visited the restroom, which was fair on the cleanliness scale. That's also when I discovered, entering the hall to the restoom, sat glasses of water on a tray, ready to be served. They weren't near the restroom, but it's still gross.

The food took at least 30 minutes, despite there being only two other parties of two seated during the wait. Not only that, but several minutes passed between the first dishes brought out and the last. In fact, my meal was last, and nearly 8 minutes behind the first plate. Since their food was getting cold I insisted the others begin.

Thankfully, my dish of chicken on garlic rice was hot and tasty. In all the food was good, with the exception of the beef in the curry dish, which was described as rubbery and unedible. The presentation was also very good.

Despite the food being a mostly good to very good,  the other factors ruined the experience. None of us will return to this place, and therefore I absolutely cannot recommend it.
author: Kenny R.

description:
I read an email from Thrillist or UrbanDaddy that featured iThai. My dentist brought it up during my appointment earlier today and ironically, I went to try the restaurant after I just got my teeth cleaned.

For a minute I thought the restaurant was closed, since it was mid afternoon and no one was inside. There was a menu posted to the right of the door so I browsed for a few minutes to decide what I want to base my review on, tough between my favorite pad kee mao or the enticing lunch specials for dine-in only (11-3pm daily including weekends!).

Finally I walked in to be greeted after 30 seconds by staff inside the kitchen. I was going to get take-out and eat in the mall but I sat down and ordered the lunch specials anyway. My meal was the $9.95 lunch special-
1) appetizer: chicken satay (2 skewers)
2) spicy basil chicken with rice

The order was taken down on an iPad, very fitting. And there is free Wi-fi.

A Yelp check-in entitled me to a free Thai iced tea. I was delighted to drink that in addition to the house soup included with the lunch special! The soup was a bit cold, probably because it was sitting out but it contained a good combination of broccoli and pepper, at least. Because I was the only one there, the food came out in a timely manner, roughly 5 minutes after the soup. The mini appetizer was served on the same plate as the entree.

The chicken satay skewers were yummy and the peanut sauce was not overpowering like other Thai establishments. I hoped for more meat or one more skewer for an appetizer but oh well. The spicy basil chicken was flavorful with the white rice. The portion size was appropriate but isn't enough to fill my stomach. However, I am on a smaller diet so it's justifiable this time.

The restroom was pretty average. Another Yelper mentioned usage of LEDs but I didn't see any at first. When you turn on the faucet...wow, pretty entertaining...makes washing hands fun almost.
author: Dominic T.

description: Placed an order via Eat24. The order never came. I was kept being told that the order was "on the way" or "5-10 mins away" and suddenly I find out it got cancelled after waiting for two hours. Ugh I am really hungry and frustrated right now.
author: Shay P.

description: Well that was $50 flushed down the toilet...so lets see the imitation Tom yum soup was awful and fell somewhere in between whole mushroom soup and Campbell's..the pad kee was nothing but overly hot noodles, with spice that was meant to shield something. There was no way that we could endure the awfulness of such poor Thai food, so we took the loss, left, and ate at the hotel. If you want burger king or taco bell of Thai this is the place to go
author: Noanya S.

description: After catching the Warriors game at the Tap Room, we headed to iThai for some boozy bites. My brother kept raving about how this spot is one of his favorites, and now I can see why! He ordered a beer tower, which wasn't ideal since I wanted to really enjoy the food without being too bloated. With that said - they have beer towers! And live music on a stage! They really know how to cater to the late night crowd. The servers were very patient with all the buzzed customers coming in, and still gave recommendations on food. We ordered the chicken wings and spring rolls for munchies, and a shrimp pad thai togo. The chicken was so good!!!!! I love wings, and really enjoyed the sauce and spicy level on these. The spring rolls were decent - nothing special, but a pretty good appetizer. Even though we had the pad thai the next day, it was delicious. The portion was huge and could easily feed 3 people. Even though we just happened to stumble across iThai that night, I hope I can return to try more food.
author: Hannah P.

description: Ordered delivery today and this was the worst delivery and food experience I've had. Food took 2 hours to arrive (window was 45-90 minutes), and food was completely cold upon arrival, underspiced, and bland. I ordered through Eat24, and when I told them this they tried to get a discount from the restaurant, but the most the restaurant would give was 10% off. Horrible customer service for such a bad experience. Food is so bad it's not getting eaten.
author: Caroline R.

description: Learn to speak English for gods sake!!!! They DO NOT understand you when you order over the phone!
author: Mojo M.

description:
I delivered food last night. I think that so delicious.I ordered Kaprow moo grob, Kao mun gai, Goong ob woon sen, Calamary, Brownrice, Fried banana with ice cream. Especially fried calamary and Kao mun gai was yummy. 
Next time I will ordered Choo Chee Salmon and ithai friedrice.
I've been there one time but at that time have friday night like band live music. It's very busy. Maybe I got some food tonight agian!
author: Santipap K.

description: I love this place. Everything I've had is amazing! It's hard not to come everyday. The waitresses are always nice and friendly, and the food comes out quick, hot and not to mention delicious.
author: Morgan W.

description: Pretty good thai food with a menu that is as expected.
author: Michael M.

description: This place is horrible. I ordered fried banana with coconut ice cream and they did not include ice cream on the delivery. When i found about it, they offered me a refund instead which ruins my dessert now. I called their restaurant after 15mins of waiting for my ice cream and the one who picked up the phone said it will take another 30mins to have my ice cream. We are near their restaurat so it should not take that long. THE LADY ON THE PHONE IS SOOOO RUDE. I am definitely not going to order at this place again!!!
author: Mel U.

description:
The Tom yum tastes like puke. Ordered online, and the menu failed to inform customers that the dish has peanuts in it. I'm not allergic to peanuts but if I was I'd make them pay for my medical bills. 
Crab fried rice was fine, tastes just like crab fried rice you can get anywhere else in SF..
I regret trying something new (tom yum) but I'm glad I ordered the crab fried rice to be safe. I probably won't order here again unless its past midnight and I want Thai.
author: Lena E.

description:
Off the beaten track but worth the walk. Service was great, food was incredible. Come hungry. The decor is pretty basic but cool.  There were a group of 9 of us and we got seated immediately and everybody was really impressed. I will be back next time I am 
in SF.
author: Daren G.

description: Good foods : rad na talay and yen ta fo hot pot are delicious
author: Tinnie L.

description:
My new favorite Thai place.  The food is:  really good quality, flavors are awesome, not greasy/heavy, pretty typical of what you'd actually find in Bangkok.  I see a lot of people on here complaining about the decor/theme.  However, their tagline is "Bangkok Street Food".  I think the decor fits just fine with that.  

Really good food and not expensive.  I come here often.
author: Allison M.

description:
My favorite Thai place in San Francisco!

My wife and I have been trying to find authentic thai food, and this is one of the few places where you can get similar food/flavor as what you can get in Thailand.

In the last 3 weeks we have ordered delivery from iThai about 10 times. My wife loves the Kao Niao Moo Ping and I love the Pad See-Ew Moo. We've also tried the Thai Sukiyaki, Green Curry Fried Rice, Phad Thai and the American Fried Rice. All of them were great!  

It might not be the right place for everyone - e.g., it's Pad Thai is not the super sweet westernized version. But it has a great selection of authentic Thai food in the city. Highly recommend!!
author: John C.

description: quick and friendly service is a strongpoint...i love the thai street style dishes that they offer that is not found in any other thai restaurants in the city...fri after 10pm the place becomes a party with a live rock band..cheers!
author: Dustin G.

description: Placed a delivery order around 12:30am on a Friday night, was told delivery was confirmed for 1:19am and the food never came.  I called the restaurant, they asked for my address, put me on hold, then hung up.  Extremely frustrating and unprofessional.  If they treat customers like this, I can't imagine what standard they use to prepare the food.  Would give 0 star if I can.
author: C H.

description:
Definitely improved a lot since the last time I came here!
Food quality was pretty good, portion sizes are pretty decent, they replaced those flimsy chairs with nicer ones.
This is a great thai restaurant with good vegetarian options, free wifi and a pretty cozy ambience. Definitely going to come here more often now!
author: Aditya M.

description:
LOVE SPICY FOOD?
Then get their Pad Kee Maw and String Bean Tofu, HOT ! (Both of them come with a choice of chicken, beef, and tofu..I'm vegetarian so I always get the tofu). Without a doubt, you should give this place a try!
author: Amanda C.

description:
Surprisingly great.  We ordered via Seamless and it got here pretty fast.
I have allergies and they called to confirm about ingredients.

Crab curry - really tasty, definitely recommend this.  For some reason it has milk in there.  I like my curries with coconut milk only.  Not too sweet :) drank up all the remaining sauce.
Garlic/pepper beef - Pretty tasty, on the saltier side but I liked it that way.  Tons of fresh garlic in there.
Grilled pork shoulder - Really awesome.  Great texture and delicate flavor.  Only wish they included slightly more meat--it's served with a lot of salad.  Sauce on the side was a little overpowering for the meat.

Would definitely come back.
author: Xue H.

description:
The food here is so average. Me and husband each had an entree, shared an app, and each had a drink. We used a scout mob and it was around $40. I wish we had gone somewhere else and paid more for better food. Not awful just not at all memorable. Actually, I do remember that the chicken satay had an odd chewy texture.

The tables and chairs are super cheap. Not at all comfortable. Poor construction. I actually like the Ikea/Apple design. I wish the food was better.

Skip it, even with the deal.
author: Kiristen R.

description:
Converted.

Not like these people: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rdIWKytq_q4

Instead for this dish: Preaw Wan.

Homemade sweet and sour sauce got me interested and the generous and delicious blend of white meat chicken and stir-fried vegetables made me a customer for life.

Service was attentive and friendly. Eight bucks was very reasonable. Only the decor underwhelmed. Cheesy if a bit bland.

Android theme might have earned them a fifth star.
author: Jason B.

description:
I ordered take out from this place and it was lightening fast. I paid with my debit card online. When the guy came to deliver, there wasn't an option to add a tip. I didn't have any cash to give him (hence me using my debit card) so I felt bad. He was still all smiles though.

The food was great. I recommend the Plamuk Tod. It's a fried calamari appetizer with this tasty spicy/sweet sauce.
author: Vivian A.

description:
Came here last night for some take out since it was on the way home. Next time I'm walking a couple of blocks out of my way for some good Thai food.

Yellow curry is my absolutely favorite curry dish, mainly because it has potatoes, and I realllly love potatoes. So what did I order here? Yellow curry of course, with a side of brown rice.

First the price came out to like $13-14 bucks! For yellow curry and rice! Overpriced compared to other Thai restaurants in the area. Second, it was the most flavorless curry I have ever tasted. I might as well have just eaten coconut milk with raw vegetables, since those weren't cooked all the way either. And the potatoes, completely uncooked, raw, crispy potatoes. I wanted to cry.

Never again, iThai. Even though your lights look cool, your food isn't!
author: Sarah H.

description: I was at work I order a delivery and I was starving .when I got the what I order it was horrible first I find hair in the soup and in the shrimp that make me feel like vomiting also the sukyaki was not good not even ok and spring rolls oily and half burned  I felt so so bad. Also it cost me 37$ with tips
author: Ussra L.

description:
I'm always down for Thai; their spices are just out of this world.

And I'll say that iThai does a fine job with the best cuisine in the world, but it wasn't mindblowing. That's a 4 out of 5 for me.

Try their soups, though. They kick with a bite that's straight out of Bangkok.
author: Kevin L.

description: The best food ever! I love spicy food!!! They definitely nail it! Came home from work around 11:30pm and was really hungry so I had order delivery. Lemongrass chicken, som tum pu salad super hot, mussaman Nuer very spicy, jasmine rice and total was 31.64 after tax.  I like how they can make it really spicy and the food was amazingly tasty! I have no complaints! Defiantly going to be ordering delivery from this place again. Can't wait to try their other dishes that they have :)
author: diana l.

description:
My friend and I got the Groupon for this restaurant.  The deal is $24 with two cocktails, one appetizer and two main dishes.  Pretty good!  So we decided to check out this place.  

We came here on a Tuesday around 5:30pm and we were the first table there.  I thought it was kinda of early but we left at 7pm and the restaurant was still empty.........

The service was pretty nice.  The girls were very friendly and helpful.  

We ordered:

Green papaya - Very standard, nothing special.

Po-Taak (Soup) - Spicy and sour soup with assorted seafood, mushroom, basil, and lime.  We asked for mild and it was not too spicy.  It tasted good.  The seafood was mostly calamari and mushroom.  

Pumpkin Curry -  Red curry with prawns, pumpkin, bell peppers, and onions.  This was my favorite dish of the night.  The curry was very creamy and flavorful.  

Kao Na Ped - Roasted duck over rice with brown gravy sauce.  The duck was good.  Very tender but the rice was little bit too soft.

We also ordered two cocktails (forgot the names) and the drinks were not impressive.  

Since we ordered one more dish, so we needed to pay full price for the extra dish.  Our bill ended up $24 more after Groupon (total will be $48 with tip).
author: Liza T.

description: Terrible place. It took more than an hour for my order and not only that,they got my order wrong and I specifically asked for extra jalapeños 3 times to make sure I get that but that clearly wasn't enough over the phone...
author: rob a.

description: Decent Food. We had a deal for some $$ off. Would not be my first choice for thai in the city. Best for lunch.
author: Janelle G.

description:
So, apparently my previous post was removed because I didn't provide enough detail of why I didn't like this place.  The only reason my post was so short, was because the experience was so... for lack of a better word... disgusting, that I didn't care to post more.  Here was my old post "I really wanted to like you because I live so close... but gross. Sorry."

So you want more details of why I gave you only one star, well here you go:

My boyfriend and I went into the restaurant because the place had opened down the street from where we live and it looked cool.  The colors/decor were neat and it seemed to be a quite popular with a full crowd.  Alas, like many restaurants who are... as Cher would put it "a full on monet," we waited for the hype to calm and decided to try the food.  Here is what we ordered:

1. Tom Yum Noodle Soup.  It was bland and not at all favorable. The fish balls were tough and honestly uneatable.  The broth was super boring and I felt like the quality overall was a one star on a grade of 1-5. I ate only two bites of it and had had enough. It's VERY RARE that I order a dinner and can't muster myself to eat more than a couple of bites.

2. My boyfriend had the iThai Seafood Noodles.  The mussels were small, dinky and frankly we thought the quality of them might make is ill.  We tried it anyway and confirmed our initial conclusion - they were gross. Secondly, the shrimp - omg where did you get the shrimp?  It was SUPER tough and flavorless. My boyfriend and I both tried a couple of bites and had enough.

The server was SUPER sweet however, and we kindly asked for containers to-go. We packaged up our food and gave it to a homeless person on our way out.  We then proceeded to another restaurant to order dinner AGAIN!!! What a waste of money.  I honestly even felt a little bad giving that food to the homeless man.

I guess my point here is that I didn't want to spend the time going into why the place was gross - it just was.  Maybe we ordered the wrong dishes?  Look, we walk past your restaurant multiple times a day - there is a reason why it is always empty.    

I'm sorry iThai.  I'm a legitimate customer with a legitimate reason to post what I posted and what I'm posting now.  People deserve to know if they're going to spend $40+ on a dinner that is flavorless and poor quality.  Hey - at least our beer was good = 1 STAR.

If you want to receive better reviews, then fork out a little more for better quality.  THEN we might return and THEN I might change my review - which I have done for many other restaurants in the past.
author: Noneya B.

description: Not really for me.  I was recommended this restaurant partially because of the convenience, but was underwhelmed by the food and restaurant itself.  I had the pumpkin curry and pad see ew, neither of which were impressive, and were both on the oily side.  Also the bowls/plates/utensils seemed to be old and I wasn't comfortable using them without wiping them down myself.
author: Josh Q.

description: Ordered delivery from here twice. First time the Khao Man Gai wasn't freshly steamed, it was old chicken reheated. Second order, I ordered the grilled chicken. Again, it was over marinated, old chicken. I ordered other things both times, but they weren't noteworthy.
author: Derrick V.

description:
The food is OK enough for a Thai restaurant that's surrounded by four other Thai restaurants.

What iThai needs is pictures on the wall. As it stands now, it feels like I'm eating in a bathroom. And they need a door. There's nothing inviting about a solid wooden door with no windows.
author: Cody R.

description:
After a long day of playing my part as a tourist, my friends wanted to go bar hopping, but I was too tired to go back out. Alone in my hotel room, I found this spot listed on Delivery . com less than a mile away from where I was staying and decided to place an order on a whim. I ended up placing an order for their iThai Seafood noodles, an order of Kra Tiam Nuer, and a portion of Jasmine rice. I placed my order at 9:56 PM on a Saturday night, and received it a little over an hour later.

While I was a bit disappointing in the time for delivery, the order arrived complete, the delivery guy seemed friendly enough, and the food piping hot. Out of the whole order, I enjoyed the seafood noodles the most. I'm a really big fan of garlic and the noodles hit the spot; the clams and shrimp were also cooked well and the basil added an interesting flavor to the garlic noodles. As for the beef dish, it was a bit blander than my liking, but it went down well with the jasmine rice. 

Overall, the delivery experience was pretty straightforward. I'd do it again if I'm in town and feeling a bit lazy after a long day.
author: Brian C.

description:
Ordered delivery.  Food came in less than 45 minutes,  Katie was well mannered and friendly.  We got Kao Pad Kark Moo-fried rice, was great! Wonderful flavors, my BF ate tge entire container lol. We also had Tom Kha Hai, Pad Tai Goong, Sur Ring Hai and fried bananas w/ice cream.  The food was fucking amazing.  Very flavorful, still warn, crunchy, crispy and everything inbetween. 

Only reason I'm not giving iThai a 5 is b/c the icream was melted (I understand that happpens) but it probably should have been in a seperate and double bag, not in the same bag as the hot, and steamy, food that mist like made the ice cream melt quicker. Also, you all should consider getting a free side dish w/the order of 2+ entries like many other food spots do. We spent $60 bucks and a free dish would have made me feel slightly less guilty about spending so much on takeout lol...

Overall, I can't wait to experience iThai in person, the pics looks like a chill spot to eat at!  I will def. Order again and reccommend to friends. 

My taste buds went craaaaaa ;)
author: Patrice S.

description:
Come to iThai if you happen to be in the neighborhood and want a casual environment to grab a quick bite. There are lights on the walls that are constantly changing and the space has a clean, minimalist approach to decorations and furniture.  

I wasn't a big fan of 1) the Creamy Crab Meat (too creamy, felt like an egg salad with crab mixed in), 2) the Massaman Nuer (beef red curry with potatoes was okay - the beef was not tender enough for me to order this again), and 3) the Pad Phed (too lemongrass-y for me and chicken was a little dry).

But, I loved 1) the Fresh Rolls - tofu and veggies wrapped in rice paper and it comes with a spicy vinaigrette that perfectly complements the roll, and 2)  the Kang Keaw Wan (bamboo shoots, eggplant, basil green curry) was awesome and pretty spicy. 

iThai delivers! I used GrubHub which was really easy and quick.  Obviously the menu can be hit or miss - but if you get a hit, you won't be disappointed.

Also, they have Singha beer ($3.5) - which goes really well with the food!
author: Kimya P.

description:
I'm not really sure how this place got 4 stars. The iOS theme is really poorly done; it's got cheesy atmosphere, not so great ordering software on the iPad, no Square device (I was expecting something high-tech about the experience), and no digital menus on the iPad (that would have been cool!)

In addition, the food was just mediocre, and it's really hard to justify going here when you've got the original Osha just around the block. 

I agree with the other reviewer that the food was not hot enough, and it didn't seem like they were putting much effort into it.
author: Mike G.

description:
I have gone here twice for take-out. First time the food was okay. This time the food was horrible. I threw it away after a few bites. The kao pad kark moo's pork belly was deep fried beyond all recognition. The pad kee mao was a congealed heap of noodles with sub-par beef, but the flavor was good with a nice spice. The lemon grass chicken tasted neither of lemongrass nor chicken, it tasted of dirty fryer oil.

There are too any good Thai places in the TL for me to order from iThai.
author: Joshua C.

description:
iThai, or iRipoffApple, is actually pretty damn good. I contemplated my decision of what to get for about 5 minutes before i saw the dish Massaman Curry. It states that it was the top dish of 2011 according to CNN.

Now I dunno if they mean just thai or all foods, but that is damn high praise and I was willing to try. On top of that, we got a free thai ice tea for checking in (Thanks Yelp!).

The curry was creamy orgasmic goodness and if you told me it was made from 4 babies and bald eagle, I would not care. CNN was right. It was so good, my friend disregarded his own dish and ordered his own. 

In regards to the ikea furniture, it was fine and comfortable so I didnt mind. Ipad pictures of desserts were tempting but was too full to get any. Decor was fine and they bring you your receipt in a plastic cube. Kinda neat.

Get the CNN Curry you bastards and you wont regret it.
author: David C.

description:
I work odd hours and often don't have time or energy to cook a meal.  iThai is one of my favourite restaurants to order delivery from. Service/delivery is friendly and very fast. 

I've found the food to be consistently good, and I am now addicted to their seafood noodles. I don't want to eat anything else, lol.  I also like that they don't tone down the spice levels like other restaurants--if it says spicy, they mean it! Overall, a solid spot for thai food cravings.
author: Ringo M.

description: Great food and service! I really like pumpkin curry. Its way better than osha! good quality food
author: Terisa R.

description: Just walked up on this place, without recommendation--tried it, and glad we did!  Food was superb, (Phad Thai, a seafood curry, fried rice, chef's special beef, and spring rolls).  Service was fine.  Would rate 5*'s with a general clean-up and some serious attention to the restroom; as another y
author: Dag E. J.

description: great food ! loved rice and curry puffs ! as a vegetarian these were my first order and i must say both are have  met my satisfaction !
author: Bhaskara C.

description: Got the pad kee Mao and green curry fried rice. The food is really nice and flavorful and came out really quickly. However the place smelled musty and the egg rolls were super oily.
author: Payal S.

description:
I was horribly disappointed. Yellow curry was watery, potatoes uncooked and no one spoke English. I was asked if I want white or brown rice
 Rice cost me 2.50. Sadly I should have driven home. -live and learn.
author: Patric A.

description: By far the BEST THAI food I've had since moving to the Bay area from L.A. and we have very good Thai Food in Thai Town back home let me say. My favorite are the Pad Kee Mao Nuer (drunken noodles) which I order at least three times a week. I've also tried the Tom Yum Goong, Tom Kha Gai (soups) and are excellent to sooth my mood on those windy cold days here in the bay. The iThai Beef salad and Larb salad with Jasmine rice and the Kang Karee Gai (yellow curry) are also a must for me. I try to switch it up every week, but always resort to what I've mentioned.  A MUST TRY while in town everytime. 5 stars iThai! - Luisa Wyndham Concierge.
author: Luisa O.

description: My first online order at Yelp. Overall, the food is good and it takes only 20 minutes to deliver. Only one thing that makes me feel weird. I was asked: How much do you want for the change....That's not how it works boy!!
author: Jeremy S.

description:
Oh my goodness, cutest servers ever! So sweet. I walked in and immediately felt calm, not only from the warm, friendly smiling people working there, but the lighting and decor were stark metallic black and warmly lit. The light above the tables felt like spotlights, but with a switch of the bulb to a warm, more subdued light...But whatever, some people really like to see their food, and I couldn't have cared less!

The food was phenomenal, and although I love Thai food, I'm creature of habit and almost always go for the chicken or vegetable curry. This time, I really wanted vegetable curry, because the description of mixed veggies sounded far more enticing than the other, but I asked the server if it was possible to get chicken in with it. After a bit of careful questioning and explaining, I ordered the veggie curry with chicken and learned it came with a variety of mushrooms, eggplant (holy moly the combo was good this round!), red peppers and other your normal usuals, like bamboo shoots, green peppers and tofu. The serving of chicken that came with it was bountiful, and I was bit surprised and elated. I ordered hot tea as usual and what a flavor and color, amber orange with a delightful, robust flavor. Even the rice came on a separate plate so nicely shaped: it looked like a tower. All of the flavors felt and tasted fresh and nourishing. My favorite Thai restaurant in SF yet, and I've tried several. 

Honestly, such a great place, I am excited to go back. I had been going across the street to Thai Stick unknowingly where I have felt not the best servers work. But here, all of the elements aligned in terms of great food, great service and niche atmosphere for your party of 2 or more. 

Definitely can't wait to go back: I have no idea what music they were playing. Not that it matters, but just saying, y'all might want to know, right?
author: Gio M.

description:
Like Kristin P., iLike. 

iThai was great. We arrived with a big group on a Wednesday night. We made reservations, but that didn't seem necessary. They were able to fit us in no problem. 

We ordered a little bit of everything and shared around the table. The waiter was very attentive, always on hand with a photo of your food (via iPad, of course) to help you decide. Unlike fast food restaurants, the food looked *just like* the photos and tasted as amazing as you'd expect. My favorite was the pumpkin curry - and all the veggie options were delish. The fried tofu was especially good as well - not dried out like you sometimes find in Thai restaurants. 

This place is a gem in the Tenderloin and worth the trek past homeless people and junkies. Just how they get away with calling it iThai is still a mystery to me.
author: Gretchen S.

description:
iLiked iThai a whole lot.  Eating in a sterile dining area with IKEA-like furniture has never been my favorite (Be My Guest Thai in the Inner Richmond), and I realize they're going for the whole clean Apple theme, but the simple quality in general seems to be the decor of choice for some of the new "hip" Asian restaurants cropping up.

The food easily blows nearby Thai restaurants out of the water.  My marker dish, the pra ram, was very good; the peanut sauce was perfect.  My friend had curry with beef and enjoyed it.  I went back to try the pad kee mao and was thoroughly satisfied.  The portions are generous, prices are standard. 

Having only been open for a month, iThai is still in its early stages; they were especially keen on providing the best service.  They are open till 11 pm, which makes them a decent option for food, pre/post-drinking from the plethora of downtown bars.

The last thing this area (this city) needs is a Thai restaurant.  There are good ones out there.  Most are average.  But great ones like iThai are hard to come by.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
As I sat down in iThai, I made the following Facebook post:

"@iThai and wondering what kind of maniac would open a new Thai restaurant in an area that already has 25 such places in a 4 block radius."

Well, I stand corrected--this was some of the tastiest Thai I've ever had, and, as one of my favorite cuisine's, I eat the pad-whatever from various places about once a week.

I had takeout: spicy-eggplant-something-or-other with beef. On the way out, the owner (his name was Poo, I think) said that he'd love to hear any suggestions I had about the food the next time I came in.  Nice touch. 

The verdict: The beef was tender, the sauce was hot but not overbearing, and had just a little hint of sweet that was fantastic.  I can't wait to try their "adventurous" column on the menu.  Minor suggestion: charge an extra buck and make the portions a tad bigger.

As a funny side note, it looks like they misprinted the menu's and instead of Creamy Crab Curry, it said Creamy Crap Curry.

And that made me LOL at the Eye Thai!
author: Rocco B.

description:
Only 3 weeks old and a new favorite! 

It was refreshing to see a menu that wasn't based on the typical pad thai of so many Thai restaurants. There's a whole section on "Adventurous" dishes but the best thing to do is to talk to the waiter and look at the drool-inducing photos of food that he'll show you on his iPad. Tell him what you like and you'll get some really delightful food. 

Here's what I ordered:
Flat noodles with ground pork and mushrooms with black bean sauce
Rice with three types of pork - sausage, bbq, and fried pork belly (holy moly, so so good)
Roti with curry (fresher and lighter curry than I expected. An absolute favorite)
Mango ice cream and fried bananas (huge portion, you should split it)

Pair that with two Thai Iced Teas and two beers and it was a feast to share! 

Come here for great, unique flavors, amazing service, and a night to change your conception of Thai food in the city.
author: Madeline N.

description:
We went there last night with a big group for my friend's birthday, We ordered a varieties of authentic Thai dishes from them.. Food was so good tasty and we enjoyed it
Sadly that we didn't get a good service from a waitress,she wasn't friendly and we had to ask her filled up a water all the time(the restaurant wasn't busy at all) 
We won't go back there for sure.. 
Sorry iThai 
Oh.. And we gave them 18% for a gratuity hehehehe .. (She would feel guilty after saw a gratuity,we wishhhhhhhhhh) 
Bye Bye iThai!!!
author: Junior M.

description:
I love this place. I order for pick up maybe three times a week here; mainly because it is located down the block from my apartment. The restaurant itself is cute and has a nice modern ambiance inside, although i have yet to dine there. It's relatively calm but more busy on the weekends if you want to dine in; the restaurant staff are always super friendly.

Some dishes i recommend on trying are...
Appetizers/Salads: gai satay, goong gra bog, larb gai, som tum pu (papaya salad with crab), yum woon sen - my personal fave.

Mains: spicy basil chicken, gai yang, tom yum goong, any of their fried rices, pad thai goong, pad see-ew with chicken - one of my other faves, karprow nuer special is delicious!!! I also recommend their kang keaw wan gai (green curry).

You can't forget a thai iced tea!
author: Anna G.

description:
Great foods with great services :) 

It's my first time dining in at iThai :) It's a great chance to see the owner in person and he's friendly and nice :) He recommended me some special dishes which were definitely awesome :) There're a lot of authentic dishes on the menu which you guys should try out. iThai is located on Post street between Jones and Leavenworth. Just give it a shot and you won't regret ;)
author: Abbey L.

description:
I have been going to ithai ever since my first visit. I guarantee you will be satisfied.  It is authentic, traditional, and very favorable.  Ever since my first visit I have become a regular and I every time.

I love practically every item on the menu I have tried. They always make me feel at home and provide great conversation and laughs when it's not too hectic and busy. 

Must Try Dishes:
Kao moo dang
3 kinds of pork, crispy, bbq, no sauce.
author: Ariel S.

description:
I have been in once before where the waitress questioned me if I was "sure that you want to order this?" I was very offended. YES thats why I ordered it.

My friend talked me into going again, so I did. This time they charged me $12 just for one order of yellow curry. I didn't even get rice! Thai Stick, which is two buildings down from iThai serves the same dish for $8.95. The cashier then proceeded to take my money without giving me my change back! Very rude. To top it off, the potatoes weren't even thoroughly cooked.

I will never return to iThai again!
author: Kayla G.

description:
There are a ton of Thai restaurants near my bf's apt, but we decided to go with iThai to try out first. Not sure what tipped us off to it - but it turned out to be a good decision.

We ordered pad thai and the Massaman curry (yes, the CNN reviewed one), as well as some chicken satay.

Everything was good...and came to us in a timely manner. There was one waitress - and what looked like a waitress in training - so at times it felt like she kept flying by trying to take care of all the tables, but it wasn't that bad. Busy means the food is good, right?

Anyways, the portion size was good, and we particularly enjoyed the peanut sauce that came with the chicken satay.

Some things to change -- I wish they had advertised the desserts somehow before we ordered our meals. I didn't know if they simply didn't serve dessert or if they only had one option and it was free, or what. So we just didn't plan for dessert and got an appetizer. Then when she came to clean up our table, and showed us the three options on her iPad, we were already too full.

(Just for the record they have a mango with sticky rice, banana fritters, and a Thai crepe like thing.)

The next time I go, I might forego the appetizer to try one of the desserts. Maybe then I can upgrade them to a 4 star review.
author: Alison C.

description:
Horrible food. Insanely oily. I actually had to spend over five minutes trying to scoop out the oil with my spoon. In addition, food was not hot. Oh I'm sorry, did you guys cook last night and forgot to reheat it in the microwave? COME ON. It is clear that this place is highly unprofessional. Lets not talk about traditional thai food, because this isn't even a comparison. This is me, telling you that they are practically serving inedible swirl. In perfect honesty, I thought it was just that I had gotten a bad item. But hey, if five of your other friends couldn't scarf down their food either - I think it tells you just how bad this place is.

Oh, just a note, their 'spicy' options generally do not exist. Neither do they have any form of food heating device such as a stove or a microwave - it seems they merely pour them out of pre-made packs that you can find at the store. Oh jolly - totally worth the fifteen dollars per person!
author: Denise T.

description: Just what I have wanted,perfect balance between spices and I told them to make it very spicy and they did it.Love it!!!!!!Same authentic food that I have in Bangkok streets.
author: Nujhat Nashia R.

description:
I wish you could give half  stars because I would give it 2 and a half. The service is really really poor, soup was served  AFTER the entree. Everything extra  I ordered I had to  re-ask for, such as extra peanut sauce, lemon for my water, and it was all served with an attitude. Really, my wife and I are  easy to please, but they were pretty rude. 
If you are an Apple/Mac fanatic, you'll like the atmosphere, the lighting, and everything is designed to look Apple-ish, even the menus like a Mac computer screen.
I liked that part of it, even being a PC guy (who does macs too), but my wife made the point that  it's a weird combo, kind of like making a Star Wars Mexican restaurant.
The pad thai was so so, I liked it less as I ate it and was less ravished.
I think you can do better food and service wise, but its cute.
author: Craig G.

description: Small friendly place. Came here first time in my first visit to SF with my brother January 2014 because it was across from where we were staying, USA hostel. Great food and cheap! Second visit with my bf and food was superb, again! Bf was impressed too. Advantage is it opens late, til 1am. Not many good places in SF are open late, they seem to shut at 10.30pm. My favourite Thai place in SF. I love the som tum salad and the shrimp pad Thai!! Free wifi :)
author: Tina N.

description: I'm pretty picky when it comes to Thai, this place has some amazing soup.  I tried some my friend ordered and it was so good.  I also got some spring rolls, I really don't like tofu and I'm used to getting Shrimp fresh rolls but these were just okay they are made so that they fall apart after one bite and it's mostly full of noodles so not much flavor.  If they added more cucumber and less carrots and some shrimp they would be much better.  I also like peanut sauce over tamarind but had to pay $2 extra for it and got more sauce than I had rolls for all I wanted was a tiny side to dip in.  Everything else here seemed really good.  only thing I have yet to try are their curries but I assume they will be good.  Always gone with groups and it's easy because they are not too busy so work out well.
author: Nirea S.

description: Excellent food, lovely staff, the only reason I'm giving 4 stars is because of the seating arrangement! Bolted tables and wooden seats makes it less comfortable, but once you start on the food you forget about your tushi :-)
author: Maja P.

description: ordered from eat24 and after 2hours wait the order was canseled, from 12.45 to 2.45am 2/27/16
author: Hin H.

description: My delivery was just an extremely disappointing experience. I have been craving sweet sticky rice with mango, and took a chance on this place instead of ordering from After Osha like I should have (best mango sticky rice ever for the same price). They called a bit after I placed my order to let me know they didn't have the garlic noodles I ordered, which was the chance to cancel my whole unfortunate order that I missed. I also ordered gai [chicken] satay and an extra cucumber salad. Those were fine but the chicken itself was a little off. What upset me the most is that the boxes inside the bag arrived completely soggy on the outside to the point where I had to use several paper towels and wash my hands repeatedly to deal with it. The mango on my overly firm rice was overripe and totally mushy; I took a few bites and was done. :( :( Oh also the guava juice I ordered had some very strange never before seen chemicals contained in the can, and I just wish there had been an option for some type of fresh juice, which I would have been happy to pay a bit more for.
author: Kate R.

description: Delivery experience thru eat24 was terrible. Food was delayed for an hour and a half. Ended up having to cancel.
author: Mai H.

description: The theme of this Thai place is cute. Tables and chairs were very simple (kind of reminded me of Ikea). They use iPad's to take your order and they show you pictures of the desserts on the iPad for you to order, unlike the traditional paper menus. I was able to get a free thai iced tea from checking in on yelp! I really enjoyed my Chicken Red Curry, however, the hit entree of the night was the Massaman curry (top rated by CNN).
author: Tina W.

description:
Nice decor! It was empty on a Sunday morning but wanted to try it. The lady at the front was super nice. 

Started off with the Keaw Wan Roti, Indian grilled bread served with green curry for dipping. I will need to order the green curry next time because this tasted so dam good!! I had the American Fried Rice, couldn't resist based on the description. And yes! Very good. Unique dish I think. Partner had the Pad Thai (this is how he tests how good a Thai place is). It was good if a little on the average side, but presentation was good. Nice prices too. I will come back. Esp since I'm just a block away ;)
author: Vol T.

description: Casual yet sort of hip, aside from the folding chairs you sit in. Surprisingly good thai food here, although the hostess/servers don't seem that interested in serving. They also seemed a little clueless when I said I walked in saying I had a reservation (via opentable), but I guess that's because the place was almost empty when we arrived. The thai iced tea is particularly sweet here.
author: Linus W.

description:
iThink iLike iThai

iPhone and Apple references aside, iThai serves up some solid eats. Is it the best, most inventive Thai ever? No. But it the service is friendly, the menu fairly diverse and the prices are affordable. And the place is super clean! 

A few colleagues and I tried a smattering of dishes, but I used most of my stomach capacity on the following:

Curry Puffs: 4/5: Tasty, fried little buggers with tender, curried chicken. Nicely offset by a sweet sauce with a touch of spice. 

Fresh Rolls: 2/5: Yeah, it's not like I expected an explosion of flavor from these rolls, but they were pretty snoozeworthy. Fresh? Yes. Something I would order again? No. Maybe more kick in the sauce would help? 

Pad Thai: 3/5: It's a solid Pad Thai. The noodles were nicely cooked, the portions were generous and it wasn't overly saucy. I asked for medium heat and I didn't really get any heat at all. Maybe next time I would push the service and really ask for some fire. 

I can see why iThai gets some love - it's a good meal for a fair price. And in San Francisco, the land of a million cuisines, iThai fits in just fine.
author: Nicole W.

description: Very convienent. Scoutmob saves the day again. The service was fast and friendly. We ordered the fried rice and the pad thai. Both were delicious.
author: David M.

description:
I just got delivery from this place, and while they were pretty speedy at 12:30am, the food lacked quality in every respect.  

I got a pumpkin curry dish - it was runny, full of mostly green peppers, and the pumpkin was green, not ripe, and undercooked.  

The woon sen noodle salad dish had only 2 shrimps, 2 rings of squid, and a bunch of noodles that were obviously cooked separately from the rest of the dish because they were congealed and could not be mixed in with any of the other vegetables to save my life.  

And finally the noodle sea food dish I got (iThai Seafood Noodles) was also lacking immensely in seafood - I had 3 clam shells: 2 of them were EMPTY.

What a shame and a disappointment.  Won't be ordering delivery from this place again.  

Bummer.   I really do wish SF would get a late night thai place that was decent.
author: Gregory S.

description:
My friends and I were hesitant to go here, but we were sick of walking and Thai House Express was still a few blocks away, so we thought we would give it a go based on the good Yelp reviews.  

Bad. Idea.

I was willing to forgive the folding IKEA chairs, the outlines of iPhones on the menus that there is no way is legal, the strange wooden celling lattice work where none of the cuts are clean, and the fact that I heard the same Goo Goo Dolls song three times while I was there.

What I couldn't forgive is the Tofu Triangle appetizer that tasted like I was biting into my memory foam mattress.  Awful texture.  No flavor.  The sauce didn't help, and it didn't taste like any sort of Thai sauce I've ever had.  Too sweet.  No savory element too it.  Ick.  After everyone has a bite and groaned in disgust, we pushed that plate to the side. 

The fresh spring rolls were SLIGHTLY better, and we finished those, but just barely.

We each ranked our meals between 2-3 stars.  My Pad Kee Mao with tofu was a 3, but VERY close to backing up over the 2.9 line.  No inspiration.  The tofu was meh.  The spices were a bit off.

The final straw?  $2 for a can of Diet Coke.  I hate places without soda on tap and free refills.

2 stars because I didn't get food poisoning.  Not 3 stars because I would NEVER go here again.  I don't know who all of these people are giving the place 4 and 5 stars, but I'm guessing they are friends and family.  After this place has been Yelped for a few more months the ratings are going to tank.
author: Bliss F.

description:
Maybe it's because I'm from the Olympia/Seattle area, but every thai restaurant I've ever frequented always asked what spice level for my food. But this(iThai) and another thai joint never does so I forget while trying to communicate an order.

The Pad Thai was basic, I added chicken, but they substituted instead. The sprouts were fresh, but the food was room temp even though it took only 15 minutes to arrive, weird...  I wouldn't eat here again in the future.
author: Matthew B.

description: Yum yum! Great fun menu and interesting selections that aren't typical for a regular old Thai place. The Nuer Nam Tok was an awesome starter.
author: Odnit D.

description: Above Average Thai Food in SF. Awesome Thai Live band for Friday night!! And Saturday Karaoke is good too.
author: Voravej S.

description:
3.5 stars

We liked the cleanliness and the service.  There was no wait on a Wednesday night. Using the check-in on yelp, we each got a free thai ice tea.  

Portion size was just right.  Food was good, but I can't say it was a lot better than other Thai restaurants.  Perhaps I was too picky since I just got back from an extended trip from Asia.  

Street parking, which was expected in the neighborhood.
author: Ka P.

description:
Since my review 4 months ago, I've noticed that the quality has dropped in greater frequency.

I used to get the brown rice which was great, but after a few orders, I started noticing that it consistently had problems (in 3 separate orders in about a 2-week period).  It was crunchy, hard, crusted (from bottom of the cooker), or not cooked enough.... so I started getting white rice instead.

When I got the Yum Kor Moo Yang (pork shoulder) salad 4 months ago, it was amazing.  However, in the past 3 orders recently, I noticed that it tasted 'different' .... more fatty and the meat was tougher and harder to chew... not quite sure what's wrong with it.

Recently, I got the Gui Chai (Chive dumplings) and 3 of the 4 dumplings'' skin were burned to the point where it was 65% black.  The 4th piece was better but over-fried.

I like their food, especially the Kaprow Gai (Spicy Basil), but I'm concerned that food quality is getting lower.
author: Max M.

description:
If you are looking for an aythentic Thai cuisine restaurant you should check out this restaurant. I went there last week and I ordered "Suer Rong Hai" which is  a terrific mouth-watering roast beef that comes with Thai style sauce. It  was very appetizing. Also Thai ice tea had a superb taste.

       The menu is varied and the price is acceptable. They also have free wi-fi and the waitresses are so cute.
author: Senol S.

description: Overall experience was okay. I ordered their pad see ew and it was pretty average. I feel that for thai food in SF, you can probably find a better spot to go to.
author: Tiffany S.

description: Worst service, waitress had a attitude we order 8 different type of food and she didn't write down and when we get our food was wrong, after we got our food she brought it one by one they didn't even bother check on us if we need anything or refill our water she only came back when she gave the checks to pay....worst service  & really bad place to eat never coming here after we spent over $100 dollars
author: Mary V.

description:
My first thought: a Thai restaurant with a tacky Apple-esque name?

My second thought: ugh, a printed menu that looks like an iPad drawn in MS Word?

My final thought: how often is too often to eat here? The flavors were delicious. The papaya salad was spicy but not to the point of tears, the soups weren't oily, and our noodles were well done.

Just remember that everyone working there is probably first-generation. Service is not going to be what you would get at a 4-star restaurant (did you think so because of the 3-foot high backlit sign on the front with the name printed on it?) so don't be afraid to flag down a server and ask for what you want... otherwise you'll sit there frustrated.
author: Isaac S.

description:
Last night was the first time I ate at ithai. Heard it was new that just opened just a few months ago. So me and a few friends decided to check it out.

The food was delicious, my friends and I were all very satisfied. And must I add there were about 6 of us and not one said anything bad about our food. Although we did inhale it all pretty quick.
And the waiter, OMG super nice.!! He was very sweet, making sure everything was ok and if we need anything.. very attentive without be so annoying nor disappearing  which was PERFECT.!!

 The restaurant was very clean, nice and trendy esp. with the changing color lights. AWESOME, good job ithai.!! and i cant forget the bathroom faucet, very NICE.!!

Also I noticed there was a stage in very back, it wasn't being used last night but i thought that was pretty COOL  to see .. wonder what or who they will have to play/sing =)

I highly recommend ithai .. A++
author: Ellen N.

description:
Went in today out of a deal on Scoubmob. Well I gotta say ... Not half bad!

I love Thai food and I have my Thai food fix on a regular basis. Most of the Thai places around my area are decent, but the food tastes very similar to each other - not in a bad way, just expected. This one surprised me!

I didn't care about the gimmicky apple theme too much but based on the food I ordered, I can definitely see myself coming back for more. I had the praam peanut cause with short rib - the best I've had ... hands down! I've had that dish many times but it's always done either a little more rich or too sweet, but the place got it just right - at least to my own standards. I also sampled my friend's curry chicken - also very well done. The food is on the light side and comparing to most other Thai places, it's almost a little watered down but that's why I find this place refreshing.

If you like your Thai food with the "kick", some of you might find this place a little too bland. To each of their own preference, I like it a little lighter cause it's different.
author: Eric L.

description: Great place to eat Thai food.they have a lot for you to order. Their food is outstanding.Great place to get a quick bite to eat.
author: Richard R.

description: Open late nights, that's the best part. It's also conveniently located in the middle of the city.  Ambience is great and also the service. Food is very average, after all, you cannot ask more at mid-night ;)
author: Ram A.

description: Prices could be lower for what you get, but overall food was pretty good and hit the spot, and the delivery was pretty fast. Would consider ordering delivery from here again.
author: Jennifer M.

description: The Pra Ram was fantastic.  It was so good I may have dreamt about it afterwards.  That's the only thing I've tried here though...
author: sean s.

description:
After walking by a few times, I decided to give it a try.  It looks interesting from the outside, like the name "iThai" suggests an Apple product, I suppose it kind of does, but more - Apple meets Will Wonka.

The service is fine, the food was good (interesting combinations) and came out quite quickly.  

The lighting was a bit much and needed to be toned down a bit.  I do agree with an earlier post about the uncomfortable plastic chairs.

One thing, I am curious to see is if others had a similar issue as I did.  I compared my credit card receipt with my statement (I always do) and I noticed that they added an extra dollar on to the tip/total.  I assume this was an innocent mistake and would never complain; however, has anyone else had the same problem?
author: Derwood A.

description:
Lunch specials are served everyday from 11am - 3pm for $9.95.  This includes Soup of the day, an appetizer of your choice (egg rolls, fresh rolls, chicken satay or fish cake), entree (various entrees over rice).  I had the chicken satay and basil chicken over rice. The soup of the day was a vegetable soup with broccoli, napa cabbage and carrots in a clear broth.  This was flavorful and delicious. The chicken satay was a little dry and the sauce was different than the usual peanut sauce (overall, it was okay, I would get something else next time), the basil chicken over rice was good.  I ordered medium spicy and it was pretty spicy.  Portions are on the small side, it would be enough for a gal but might not be enough for a guy.  

Service was a little slow but it was fine since we weren't in a hurry.  

3.5stars, I would come back if I was in the area and wanted thai food
author: Veronica N.

description: Delivery sucks here and they ask for cash tip even when you pay with your credit card. The food is mediocre at best.
author: Monique L.

description: Good stuff, Deliverying keeps me from starving to death in a Saturday night
author: Joseph L.

description: Delicious! Had the Garlic Noodles and a Crab Curry dish and was pleasantly surprised. Didn't have high expectations because I had yet to find a Thai Restaurant I liked. Ordered through Grubhub, food came quickly, delivery guy was friendly and food had so much flavor. Have never been to the restaurant but I highly recommend for delivery.
author: Leslie G.

description:
This place is pretty awesomely themed. They are going for the look of an Apple store...white everything, cool lights on the walls, etc.

I had the appetizer sampler and would definitely recommend it if this is your first time eating here as you get to sample almost all the appetizers. The egg rolls were freaking amazing and the peanut sauce was one of the best I've tasted.

I got the fried chicken over fried rice entree and it was cooked to perfection. A definite must try if you're in the Union Square area.
author: J S.

description:
My bf and I were walking around trying to decide what to eat on a busy Saturday night in Union Square...nothing sounded good and our moral was running low after countless attempts of finding restaurants packed to the seams. We saw iThai with just a few couples  cheery in conversation and thought "shoot,why not?". We've never had Thai food but how bad could it be (coming from two foodies).

Walked in the door and was immediately greeted by what looked like a mother and daughter team. They were all smiles and quickly took us to a table in the corner. We asked what was popular or what to order and she brought out some pork wontons and  chicken satay with peanut sauce. Omg,probably one of the best wontons I've ever had. It was so crunchy and flakey,meat perfectly cooked, but the sweet/spicy sauce was amazing! (Couldn't help but sop it all up with our leftover rice) The chicken skewers were also perfectly cooked and had (another) tasty sauce,along with some charred bread. For a main course my bf ordered a beef plate which came with rice and veggies, while I ordered the silver noodle soup. Broth was perfect. Everything was so flavorful and looked appealing. We shared some soju which was interesting,in a good way? I'd never had it before,but tasted like a warm beer/wine. Tasty. Lastly we ordered her recommended dessert. Honestly I can't remember what it was called but my goodness, I could have eaten it for my whole meal! It was like a thin dough that was fried with condensed milk and a little sugar. Make sure to order it!! 

They let us sit and talk for over an hour and never rushed us. They were so friendly and helpful that I will DEFINITELY come back if I'm in the area. Oh,and did I mention the dishes are all about $10 or less?! How awesome is that!
author: Danielle K.

description: TERRIBLE. I asked for a soda and 20 minutes went by and I still hadn't received my drink. I had to get up and remind the girl that I had even ordered a drink and she just laughed and then gave it to me half filled up.. Then my chicken that I ordered was burnt and literally pitch black. Fuck this place.
author: Lea S.

description:
I was drawn to this restaurant because of their cool design/layout and it's pretty clean.
When my husband and I checked-in we had free thai iced tea. Then we ordered fried rice, noodles, and a side dish (i forgot what it's called but it has eggplant in it). Taste-wise, all three dishes were good, I just wish they have bigger serving size though. 
All in all, definitely, we'll be coming back. :)
author: Ella B.

description: Great atmosphere with nice low ambient lighting. Food was good....nothing special but enjoyable. I'd come back.
author: Justin C.

description:
This review is for a delivery.
1. Took an hour and forty minutes.
2. Food was cold.
3. Driver was rude.
4. Egg shells in the Pad-see-ew.

Overall it was over priced and not worth the wait for average food.
author: Drew L.

description: I think they dumb down the spicy for wimpy Americans, muahaha.
author: Katrina N.

description:
I am not really sure how to describe iThai.... the food is GREAT the atmosphere is... weird? I believe they have gotten some new furniture lately, but the inside of the restaurant looks like they went to ikea and tried to make it look like an apple store, it doesnt really work. 

However, I highly recommend getting carry out or delivery! The food is delicious, probably my favorite Thai food I have had in the city. My favorites are the Pad Kee Mao Nuer and Masaman Nuer Curry. I am not usually one to get meet with thai, I just prefer tofu, but who wouldn't want short ribs in their curry?! Just be warned... its spicy! 

Re-cap... GREAT food, weird atmosphere... get the food to go.
author: Jess K.

description: This review is for the Pu Nim Pad Pong Kari (Soft Shell Crab curry) -- it was absolutely delicious. The green papaya salad was standard. Kanom Pak Kad was a little underwhelming but exactly as described, and the Kao Ka Mu was very good (and somewhat reminiscent of Taiwanese pork dishes). The delivery came in about 45 minutes.
author: Jenny L.

description: Delicious.  I had pad Thai, panang and tom kha Kai.  I order delivery from all over SF all the time and this was delicious and open late!
author: Shannon J.

description: Not everyone is a legitimate food critic and whos to say the negative criticism viewed on this restaurant is a product of some malicious mind. But let me tell you, I am one tough person to please when it comes to food. Ithai has provided my friends and I delicious dishes and the best quality service consistently! We used them to cater our party last weekend and was a huge success! Everyone raved about the food! I highly recommend this place to anyone! The way I see it is....if the people writing very damaging food reviews are certified food critics or can at least cook a better meal than these folks can, ill believe them. If not, they should eat at home! Go ahead readers give it a try and tell them Ricci sent you! You wont regret it! Bon Appetit!
author: Ricci S.

description:
We wanted some Thai food within walking distance of Union Square and found this place on Yelp so decided to give it a try.  I ordered the Kao Pad Kark Moo and it was pretty good, serving size was big enough to share.  My sister got the Thai Sukiyaki and it was too spicy!  The server never asked her what spice level she wanted.  Funnily they asked us how spicy we want the Tom Kha to be, told them mild and there was no spice at all.  Even if it weren't too spicy, I wouldn't recommend getting that noodle dish.  

Now on to the service...definitely bad!  The servers were friendly enough but there were only 2 of them running around trying to help everyone.  We waited almost 10 minutes before the server came back to take our order.  We had to ask for cups when our soup came.  I also had to go up to the counter to ask and pay for our bill.  We went on a Sunday night around 8pm.  Maybe the place isn't normally this busy on a Sunday but we certainly caught it at a bad time.
author: Annalee L.

description: because of the somewhat tacky theme, I had low expectations of this place but I've been searching for thai food that actually tasted like it's from thailand and boy they sure did hit the spot when it came to spiciness. I had the seafood garlic noodles and the pumpkin curry and it was really good, much better then i expected. I'm looking forward to trying their tom yum. =)
author: Tiff W.

description: Ordered chicken pad thai to take away but unfortunately got food poisoning the day after. A warning sign should have been the fact they said it would be ready in 15 minutes but came out after 3-4 minutes. Tasted great at the time then the day after was followed by instant regret!!
author: Greg R.

description:
Ok, so the food is average to good Thai food.  Nothing to complain about per se...We went there on a Saturday afternoon so it wasn't too busy and the service was solid.

My main issue comes from the Groupon.  I paid $25 for $50 worth of food, which is what is states. However, the girl working there told us that it is really 1 app, 2 drinks, 2 entree and dessert...but that only added up about $42 worth of food and we figured we could have ordered another drink or appetizer...but nope...so that was disappointing, that wasn't in the fine print....so...ehhh.
author: Eric S.

description: I did take out at iThai because I wanted to try something else besides Lers Ros and Thai House Express.  The take out food ordered was a bit slow compared to the other places. It took about 20 mins to get my order of 3 dishes. The servers were very friendly and offered to give me a free thai ice tea (even though it was only for dine in). The food though was pretty good. The pad thai had mini dried shrimps which added a twist to the flavor.  We also had the chicken soup noodle also was solid, and duck larb which had generous bites of tender duck mixed with the spices and lettuce.  Prices are better than Lers Ros which to me has gotten overpriced because of their popularity. Overall, good place that I would try again.
author: James W.

description: I came here twice this month.  Both times, the food was really tasty.  The flavors are intense,  reminds me of the street stand in Bangkok.  I tried the ithai spicy noodles, spicy clams and tom yum noodle soup.  The spicy noodle was reaaaaallllly spicy...however, I love spicy dishes so this was up my alley.  Spicy clam dish was excellent, spicy level was mild and was generous in portion.  Tom Yum noodle soup was okay but not great.  It had a bit of coconut milk in the broth so it is a little different.  I prefer the traditional style.  The price range is reasonable for the area.  Overall my experience was good will definitely come back, plus they also do free delivery with minimum of $20, so this is a plus.
author: Eva E.

description: The food was decent. Prices are a bit high for what you get. I can't comment on the service since I ordered take-out, but the place seems nice. Also, they're open late, which is great.
author: Ehtesham K.

description: I've only ordered delivery, but man, this food was fantastic. The food always is packed with flavor and the pad thai is reeediculous. I ordered the fried calamari and they packaged it with an opening in the container so that the steam didn't turn it into a bunch of soggy tentacle slices. Place is great.
author: Craig F.

description: I like this Thai restaurant they have night club and band at night! I would go there again and I will bring all of my friends there!
author: Xiyu W.

description: I got chicken curry as take out and it was great!  I decided to give this place a try because of its fresh look, and I was happy with my choice.
author: Maria T.

description: I ordered in from Seamless as I had to work over lunch.. Their Pad Thai was bland and barely edible.. Don't even get me started about their papaya salad. I know it said spicy, but lay off, will ya?! it was so spicy that what's supposed to be green papaya and it was dyed dark pink/red from all the spice. I like spice, but they botched the salad way bad. I had one fork full and threw the rest out. needless to say, I will not be ordering from this place anymore..
author: Michelle V.

description: The restaurant was very casual and somewhat modern looking. The service was good and the food was not too bad. Ordered the seafood noodles ( had clams, shrimp, and calamari) and duck curry. The noodles were well seasoned, a little spicy for me. But who's kidding I suck at eating spicy food. As for the curry, for me, it was a little bit towards the sour side. I think there were too many pineapples. Otherwise, the duck was yummy!
author: Nhung T.

description:
the concept of the funny is funny and quite nice.
the service is not perfect, though. the waitress forgot I had ordered a sparkling water and I had to ask her three times, although there was not a lot of customers in the restaurant so she was not that busy.
I had pad thai, I liked that it was a really big plate, I couldn't finish it and i had to take a box for my left-over. but the dish was lacking some tastes.
it's not too pricy, which is nice.
author: Andrea C.

description: Delicious! Excellent service, not crowded, and not expensive. Nice low-key atmosphere too if you aren't looking for a fancy night out. The only reason this gets four stars instead of five is because parking around there can be brutal.
author: Andrew M.

description: Pretty decent food. Veggies were definitely fresh which is a big plus, but my noodles seemed slightly undercooked. Having said that, i would eat here again.
author: Channing J.

description: I've only ordered for delivery. This restaurant caught my attention due to their menu, they have much more different dishes then the other restaurants.  The 15 times that I've ordered here all of the dishes are good or very good. When requesting spicy or very spicy it actually is.  Most of the time I have to call over the phone to get the Thai spicy since I speak Thai but this place it's not necessary.
author: Jossy S.

description:
So, i bought a groupon for a dinner for 2 (1 appetizer,soup or salad+2 entrees+2 drinks), i was excited because i've been wanting to go for a while but idk lol 
so, i go there with my boyfriend on Sunday 1/27 at around 7pm, get seated on these super uncomfortable white IKEA folded chairs (seriously?!). The young waitress is super nice (college student i think), i show her the groupon, we order drinks and wait. We ordered 1 Thai iced tea, 1 regular iced tea, fried calamari as an appetizer ( freshly deep fried, delish) my entree choice was a spicy seafood noodle thingy , my boyfriends was seafood Thai fried rice( soooo good).
