My food was super spicy :( and here comes the decorative clams, they were sour but i didn't really care at the time, i love clams. Went home, slept, 3 to 4 hours later, wake up in sweats, my tummy in pain, DIARRHEA NIGHTMARE !!! So, yeah those effing clams. I won't be going back to iThai.
author: Meriem B.

description: I'm very picky when it comes to Thai food.  I thought my husband and I would try this place, since we had a Groupon.  We had the Thai rice soup and Thai salad.  We were pleasantly surprised because they gave pretty hefty portions.  He ordered the cashew nut and I ordered the fried chicken with garlic rice.  Everything was delicious and I think we may have found our favorite restaurant for Thai food.  I will definitely come back here.  We had so much leftovers and so happy I don't have to cook for hubby tomorrow night.
author: Terry S.

description: Stopped here for lunch. Service was friendly and fast. I ordered pad Thai with chicken instead of the shrimp. Very flavorful. Yum!!!
author: S C.

description:
Dinner last night was A-Ok, walking distance from the craziness of union square and the theater district. We'd been standing outside of Curran trying to win lottery tickets to The Book of Mormon and in defeat we were looking for good/reasonable grub on our way home. Found this place on Scoutmob and got an ok deal ($36 for two--2 apps, 2 entrees, 2 teas). Unfortunately after standing outside an hour this place wasn't very cozy and we continued to freeze throughout the meal--concrete floors, ikea tables/folding chairs, metal + red lights on the walls--although they did keep our hot Thai teas full. It was quiet for a Saturday night and a good option for groups (there was a table of 8 when we came in) as the surrounding Thai joints were packed.

Tried curry puffs (like fried potstickers, very savory), Roti (delicious curry dipping sauce), Jessy's Noodles (healthier option as they're steamed not fried, but delish!), and the spicy basil (also very savory and delish). Probably won't be back without another "deal" but the food did hit the spot after a long evening. Maybe take-out.
author: Darya P.

description: iThai is gimmicky... but the food is great! They have things on their menu that other Thai places do not offer which definitely sets them apart from the other 5 Thai restaurants on the street.
author: Frances L.

description: I was really hungry & my mouth was watering over the idea if a Pad Thai, I stopped in here for take out & the service was awful, grumpy young man & bad food! 3 prawns in my dish & far to sweet!! Tasted of sloppy noodles and sweet jam, this city has so many amazing places to eat that I shan't be going back.
author: Verity R.

description: How amazing here was too crowd last night i've never seen before!! I supposed to dine in here but changed mind to take out after seeing those people.. lol :) I waited my egg rolls, kang karee and creamy crab curry about more than half an hour. Is that too long? I don't think so!! Because their food were always delicious and girls on front very nice. Thanks and I really appreciated. :))
author: Kat S.

description: You know it's a bad sign when after only one appetizer your entire table is debating how bad the Yelp review will be. There are so many great Thai places in San Francisco (Basil Canteen! Thai House Express!), but this is not one of them. And note to owner: please play something else besides the same Goo Goo Dolls song on repeat.
author: Amy Z.

description: I don't know where to start. All we wanted was some Thai food. Some awesome, fried, tasty Thai food. We ordered through Grubhub on a Tuesday at 10:30... And waited. And waited. And called Grubhub twice to check the status of the delivery. Mind you, I'm pretty patient with people in the service industry. (Even when I've barely eaten that day, as is the case.) Two hours after we placed our order, it finally showed up. As I'm typing this I'm picking my way through soggy luke-warm appetizers. My fried tofu is actually cold. My belly is sad. It's worth mentioning that iThai is less than a mile from where we had our food delivered. I'd comment on the quality of the food, but I don't know what it was supposed to taste like before everything went room-temp and gross. It's not the worst food in the world, and I'm eating it because I'm hungry as hell, but I'm not ever ordering from here again.
author: Heather T.

description: Accidental find.  Delicious.  Great service for a late Sunday night meal.  Highly recommend curry puffs, kaprow gai, and garlic ginger rice.  If you like spice this is the spot for you.
author: Stacey E.

description: It was good, I'd go back, but it probably wouldn't be my first choice. The one irritating thing: That door never stays closed on its own. It gets cold, and thus your food gets cold. :-/
author: Angelic S.

description:
There are many Thai restaurants in the Tenderloin/Downtown/No Hill area, but I came upon this new trendy Thai place on Yelp in hopes that I can entertain my good friends and have a good time for dinner; thankfully we were not disappointed. We ordered 5 dishes for five people. We ordered: Crab Fried Rice, Pad See Ew noodles, Pumpkin Curry with tofu, Pad Thai, and a fried rice dish that had bits of dried fried pork in it. Every dish was very good and the proportions were good for sharing with the exception of the Pad See Ew being a bit smaller than others. But other than that, we had good service and our host/server (who I believe is also the owner) came by to check us, refill our water, and give us recommendations. The food is yummy, the decor is clean, restroom is like a mini disco and clean, reasonably priced (around $8-12 for entree) I'd def come back again to eat and enjoy a good meal.

P/S-I forgot about the dessert, their roti and coconut ice cream is deliciious, definitely worth a try!
author: Annie T.

description:
Hard to give it five stars as I have only been there twice, but good prices and great quality have a spot in my heart. 

Can't remember the name of the dish, but they have a curry dish with rib meat and potatoes that is amazing. Green curry fried rice is a HUGE portion that is equally as tasty as it is big. The unfried veggie rolls were fresh and tasty. The classic eggplant + choose your meat was REALLY tasty, not undercooked or over sauced. 

Decor is clean but somewhat sterile. Service is fantastic and the guy who runs it (maybe not owner, but always there with his ipad) is very friendly and helpful.
author: Nick B.

description:
This place is surprisingly good. I was worried to see _another_ Thai place open up in a neighborhood packed with Thai places, but it manages to stand out in style and substance. Prices aren't bad either. I've mostly ordered off the I'm Adventurous menu, my favorite being the Kao Klook Gapi. And by favorite I mean my favorite dish of any kind in a several-block radius. It's really killer. 

Try this place and avoid the overpriced tourist traps down the street. Five stars for being the best in the neighborhood.
author: Phil D.

description: I had dinner here tonight and was quite impressed. The food is very good.  I had the creamy crab curry, my husband had the pad kee mao with pork, and we shared the roti appetizer. All were very good. Since we live so close, and had a good first experience, we will definitely be back to try more. The 'top 40' music could be better; it didn't seem to fit with the image they are going for. They could also work some on the timing of their food, since one entree came only minutes after the appetizer, and my husband had to wait a bit for his entree.
author: Rise G.

description:
I got delivery here on Saturday at noon, because Lers Ros begins delivery at 5.
Ordered the pad thai, chicken larb, and som tum.
The larb was the best thing, and it was just okay.  It was spicy and salty, but I honeslty don't think there was any mint in the thing, and mint is what makes larb so good.
The som tum wasn't really that fresh, I like mine with a crunch and it was just kind over seasoned and wet.
The pad thai just wasn't that flavorful.  It didn't seem sauced enough.

Overall dissapointing, nothing seemed that fresh.  I can't imagine ordering from there again.
author: YJ P.

description: Tofu soup too salty and spicy, can only taste salt. Waiter was rude.
author: Serge U.

description:
nice spot to grab a late night bite.  

prices are reasonably priced and the employees are very friendly.

wanted a quick bite to help me sober up so i ordered the fried calamari and the chicken satay skewers to go.  

chicken was very tender and flavored well.  calamari wasnt heavy although it was deep fried...the sauce they gave for dipping was solid as well.

need to come by here when im not completely destroyed.
author: Kyu L.

description: It's just opened today. Their food taste great and it's not expensive at all.
author: Arsid K.

description: the "i" theme is a little tacky.  The service was decent.  Enjoyed the go-to pad thai, but wouldn't go for the fried chicken/fried rice or the fresh rolls again.
author: Bobby R.

description: Worst delivery service ever. I can wait an hour, but two and a half? And they really do not care how many times you call them. Never ordering from them again. Besides there are far better thai places in the area.
author: Emily M.

description: Very nice little place, we just got in late one night and needed a quick take out and ithai looked great, the service was nice and fast too. Delicious meals, massive menu to choose from and some of the best Thai I have had.
author: Erika M.

description: Tried the lychee mimosa.... Wouldn't order it again... But the larb was good n curry puffs decent.... Should have tried to Pad See Eww to really be sure if I liked this place.
author: Wing W.

description: The Tom Ka Gai was good and the portion huge, however the beef salad I had was way too salty. Service was friendly, the deco is indeed arguable.
author: Benjamin S.

description:
iLike!  (sorry, I couldn't iHelp myself)

So, my book club came here on a Wednesday night because we had just read Steve Jobs' biography and wanted an Apple-themed restaurant choice.  Wouldn't you know that there's a Thai restaurant in the Tenderloin that looks like an Apple store-- amazing!

I called the day before to have them set up a table for us (we were 10), but they forgot-- wasn't a problem, they just put one together when we started to arrive.  The place never got crowded, they seem to do a bit of take out business.

Service was really nice and friendly; our server, outfitted with an iPad, was eager to show us pictures of any and all dishes we were interested in.  It was kinda funny and also helpful.  

Everything we had was good!  Like, just as good as Osha or Thai House Express...probably like, half a degree down from Lers Ros, which is my gold standard for Thai).  I think my favorite dish was the pumpkin curry and the spicy eggplant (we had it with chicken, as recommended by our server).  

Prices are standard, parking is a bitch and walking around by one's self is treacherous, but definitely a place to try if you're hungry and in the hood.
author: Kristin P.

description: Awesome food!!! At first sight !! Just randomly because close to my apartment and I finally had a chance to try it ..
author: Parn P.

description: Advertised as Bangkok street food it's very good Thai at a reasonable price. And the atmosphere is nice too. As others have said, minimalist but clean and decent sized so plenty of places to sit. Good service too.
author: Laura B.

description: Lunch combos are wonderful. Appetizer, soup, rice and a small entree for $10. Good food, and plenty of it. Prompt, friendly service. Extremely reasonable price. Not the quietest venue around, but very trendy and a good find.
author: Matthew M.

description:
this place is fun. for what seems to be a rip off of some company we all know, they serve pretty good food. 

we tried the Massaman curry (CNN something), American fried rice (fried with ketchup), catfish dish.. and from the yelp check-in, we got a free thai iced tea and they offered really yummy coonout ice cream on the house.

The curry was pretty good, it did not work with the fried rice for the obvious reason so we went on and got another bowl of jasmine rice. try the american fried rice.. that's definitely something new.

the waiter was pretty friendly and attentive. I am not sure if i could go back there since it's far from where i live but i'd love to tell my friends to try this place, just for the "splendid" experience! hahaha
author: Sung C.

description: I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the food at iThai.  I'm a big fan of Pad Kee Mao, and thus far this is my second favorite place for noodles in the area.  Decent portions, and the service was fantastic.  I will be going back.
author: Chris G.

description: I love you, iThai but why do you keep messing up my order?! We've ordered from iThai 10 times now. The first 8 times went smoothly. I'm vegetarian and my husband isn't so our order isn't always the most straightforward but they always managed to get it right...until recently. We had friends over and ordered a big order from iThai and were raving to our friends about how great this place is. Our order showed up an hour and a half late and our guests were starving. We felt awful. We ordered from grubhub and they spoke to iThai and managed to get us our money back but we were still disappointed. Tonight my husband and I ordered again and they forgot the chicken in the curry (the only meat dish we had) and I feel bad because my husband didn't get any meat for dinner. Argh, iThai...I really want you to be my go to thai delivery spot but you need to stop messing up and be more reliable/consistent!
author: Neha R.

description: I go here often possibly too often, but how good you not great food, good staff, good prices. Most of all prompt service and Thai ice tea.
author: Roxy H.

description: Stumbled across this place with my friend when we were actually headed somewhere else for lunch but thought we'd give it a try. I think they had just opened. We were the only ones in there for a good 20 minutes but slowly people started to come in. Waiter was very nice. I loved the modern decor and the fact that Adele was in the music rotation. I ordered some crazy rice, chicken sausage plate and had a fried egg put on top. It was very very good. My friend had a big ole bowl of prawn soup and he loved it. The only complaint.... $3 for a small Cranberry juice???? I guess the fact that their food prices are pretty decent they make it up in juice prices.
author: lisa v.

description:
I have been with a friend to Ithai many times.  The food is good, the service from the waitresses is great, they always seem really happy. Being an international student I have so much work that I can't cook for myself and eat at Ithai. I can count on my hand that I have been to Ithai more than 3 times a week, with my friend, and also bringing other people as well. However, I will never be going back to Ithai again after how rude one guy who worked there (we think it's the manager). It started when my friend ordered food and I decided I wanted to eat at Ithai. He picked up his food and we sat down to eat. The guy who was serving us seemed to be in a very bad mood. We ignored it and sat down. I ordered food and we started to eat. The waiter/manager, was upset since my friend sat down with his take out food and not a plate, so he decided to put it in a plate which was ok, but they way he went about it seemed like he was upset. The whole time we were there the guy didn't ask us if the food was ok, if we needed anything, nothing until we were done eating. After we were done eating the check was about $8.70 and I used cash and gave $9 because of the bad service. We walked outside and the next thing you know we see the waiter/manager, coming up behind us holding the change from the check and saying "No you need this, take it", "you need this more than me". He then put the change in my pocket without me allowing him to. 

My friend and I were so shocked we thought we were dreaming. The actual tip for him would have been 70 more cents, and he could have easily just said I need just a little more change please. I didn't give him a good tip since the service was poor. However the service was one of the worst, and no matter how good the food is and the service from everyone else (the girls), I will not be going back there again. It's not the customer's fault that your having a bad day. If he is the manager than he needs to treat people with more respect and with a better attitude. He was unprofessional, and didn't not act like a manager by coming out of his store to give us the change.  I recommend this place for the ok prices, and the good food. The guy just treated us very badly, and for us we will not be going back again.
author: Andreas D.

description:
cute place! the inside decor was definitely different than all the other restaurants in union square/nob hill. the place was very modern; the waitress takes your order with a ipad and also shows you the dessert menu on it. definitely a good idea compared to the usual scribble-on-a-pad. their ithai combo appetizer lets you try their best appetizers on the menu. the fried calamari was good; you can actually taste the calamari instead of just of the breaded crumbs and oil like many restaurants' calamari.

the highlight of the night were the lychee mimosas. they weren't too fruity or strong; just the right mix. absolutely yummy. there are 3 thai restaurants on this block alone and i am glad to have tried out this place.
author: The Hangry Chef O.

description: Great food!  We went there twice while in San Fran because the food was so good. Definitely try the cashew nut chicken!
author: Tiffany H.

description: We had a groupon voucher $28 for 4, which included 4 drinks and 4 entrees. The decor is pretty minimal. They could add some color to the walls or something, but it wasn't terrible. We told the waitress we were in a rush and she said she would try to have the chef hurry with our plates. There was only 2 other people in the place eating at lunch on a Monday. We had the Tom Kai Gai- which was very flavorful and full of chicken and mushrooms. It was really good. Pad Thai was okay. Pad See-Ew was good and smoky, with big pieces of chicken. My daughter loved this and the pad thai. Everyone loved the Kang Karee Gai (yellow curry chicken). The yellow sauce was very smooth and flavorful. With this groupon we couldn't go wrong. 3 thai coffees and a soft drink included as well. The portions were good sized, filling and we had left overs. Our bill was $4 in tax, plus full tip.  Our meal would have been $45 plus tax and tip otherwise. We would go again with or without the Groupon. Good food doesn't always have to have the best decor.
author: Marisa M.

description: A Groupon got me in the door, but the food and service were amazing. Had the Pad Thai and it was excellent.
author: Edward I.

description: Good size portions and inexpensive. Austere decor but we don't mind. Service was fine. Would recommend.
author: Carol A.

description: Decor is "interesting" but the food is pretty darn good. I ordered  the Pad Kee Maw which lived up to the spicy notation on the menu. Not blazing hot but spicier than other places that use the "spicy" notation on the menu but don't deliver.  Decent portion sizes; not huge but good for the price.
author: Joe P.

description: Pretty gimmicky but this place is pretty good and very reasonable prices.  We had the normal stuff chicken pad thai and beef salad and although the tables, chairs, etc all look a bit cheap the food definitely is quality you would get at Osha Thai and other more expensive places
author: Hector A.

description:
WORST SERVICE EVER!!!!! So a few weeks back iThai opened up only a few doors down from where I live. With their flashy expensive lights I was drawn in, and my boyfriend and  decided to venture to have a nice casual quick dinner.... Nice... not so much, casual... yes, quick... HECK NO! We left the house at 8:40pm and (it takes 2 minutes to walk there) we got back home after 10! Upon arriving at iThai we were surprised by the number of people inside... of course the logical thought was, "oh it must be good! It's packed on a Sunday night!" WRONG! The place, we later discovered, was packed because  half the people were not being served correctly or were waiting for their food. 

So, a two minute wait before getting seated.. No problem. 
We sit down with our menus, and within 5 minutes both my boyfriend and I know what we want. He wants to order the Pad Thai, hot sake and the Satay appetizer. I want to order brown rice, yellow curry and a Thai iced coffee. The problem, where's our waitress? So we wait... and wait.... and wait... and after 20 minutes I'm fuming at the table. No one approached us, no one said  " Hey i'm here to take your order!" I finally had to holler down one of the girls and she comes by. So, I tell her we have been waiting 20 minutes and she writes down the order, repeats it twice and scurries off. Less than five minutes later they bussle out the Satay, the pad thai and my brown rice. Now I don't know about you, but it's kind of weird when one person gets their food before you... let alone with the appetizer! So we eat the appetizer, I stare at my brown rice, he stares at his pad thai because he doesn't want to eat without me and since I don't have my curry what am I supposed to do with the rice!???

So we wait..... and wait.... and guess what! We WAIT SOME MORE! Behind us I overhear a customer get up, go to the counter with his bill and say, "Yeah, I'm not ok. You're charging me and I never got my food!" and stormed out! This guy was sitting before we got seated so how long was he waiting!??

So finally, I'm super upset. At this point I almost wanted to just walk out, but instead I hollered again and the second waitress stops by. I say, " We don't have our drinks, I never got my curry, and my rice is cold!" and she asks, "Oh did I take your order??" THERE'S  20 PEOPLE IN THE PLACE! ATLEAST LOOK AT A CUSTOMER! So she apologizes, runs off and brings our drinks. About another 10 minutes later, I get my curry and warm rice... The boyfriend ate his Pad Thai cold. I ate half, and I usually don't waste food, but we wanted out. Risking the " Can I get a to-go box?" question probably would have set us back another 45 minutes. So upon receiving the bill we didn't even allow the waitress to run off. It was a "CHARGE IT AND LETS GO!" move. So we get charged.... with a "sorry we screwed up please come back and don't write a mean review on Yelp" discount and walk out totally disappointed. \

Please... If you go, dedicate 2 hours of your life at a minimum. 
And if you don't go.... good for you, because I know I won't be going back.
author: RP S.

description: I was so very surprised to find this clean and well run restaurant near ACT.  The crab curry and th Pad Thai were excellent as was the service.  They were friendly, and we will for sure be returning to this nice place.   The prices could have been a bit cheaper, but we enjoyed it all the same.
author: george i.

description: lychee martinis, pad thai and papaya salad are yuummmy!!  this is my go-to thai restaurant in the tender nob hood.  it's not really fair for me to review thai restaurants as i grew up having authentic home cooked thai food.  i found some of the dishes here, such as the pad thai and papaya salad, to be quite authentic.   if you're in the tender nob area this is your best bet for thai food.
author: Mao K.

description: I've been meaning to review this place for a while since i've been here a few times already. The food here is great its pretty authentic (except for a few dishes) and I'm Thai so I would definitely know. The first time i was here they had me sit on these fold out chairs which i was so confused about. A definite minus on the ambiance. But i was just here yesterday and saw that they bought new wood chairs and decorated just a little more. There's not too much to say the waitresses were nice and served the food promptly. The only downside is the parking which can be kind of tricky. I circled around about 5 times before i found parking. Oh yeah i forgot. They do karaoke here on certain days i think. Which i actually find annoying, I like being able to actually talk to friends while having dinner. So yeah thats a downside too. Luckily there wasnt any when i went in. If you dont like loud karaoke definitely make sure to call and ask if they there is going to be any on the day you come in.
author: Sara S.

description: Very good food. For drinks I had the Thai Iced tea which was nice, I also had a glass of wine. This fried rice plate with meat that was very good. Waiters were very quick, glass was always topped off and very reasonably priced. Also, the sink in the bathroom is amazing, you just have to see it.
author: Ameer A.

description: Fun menu and efficient service but the food was really nothing to write home about--I've had better thai at many places in the city. The environment is also a bit strange. The cool minimalist aesthetic is fine but the place seems to need a little sprucing up and better attention to detail.
author: Geoffrey U.

description: We had lunch here. Our waitress was very knowledgeable and friendly. She asked us what kind of food we like and then told us about the options. I had the green curry fried rice non spicy. It was very delicious.
author: Nicholas S.

description: I have not had a bad meal here. The curries are good, the noodles are amazing, and the portions are perfect. True, the decore is a little weird but the food is great and the prices are reasonable.
author: John W.

description: We ordered the Penang curry which sucked. Crab fried rice wasnt good either and tom yum noodle soup was soso. We asked the waiter if there were peanuts in any of them cus my friend's allergic, she said no. so we started eating, and my friend had an allergic reaction...we asked another waiter if there were any peanuts...the guy said Penang and the soup did lol. so they swapped the penang for red curry.  waitress fail. she could have killed someone! I need to go with someone thai to eat there. I obviosuly dont know what to order.
author: Cindy L.

description: good food, good portion sizes, mediocre service, strange/fun setting not exactly relaxing but karaoke should exist here, kind of pricey for thai but they deliver if you cant hang with the peppy dining room crowd
author: Alicia G.

description: i love ithai. we all do here at our salon. goody and pooh are the funniest, straight forward guys and the food is always spot on. the lunch special is the best deal in town. delish soup, an app, an entree and rice. super filling, super spicy, super tasty. love you guys. best dessert with coconut and mango ice creams and those sweet little dessert pancakes. yum. ok i officially just made myself hungry writing this review.
author: Holly D.

description: This place has great pad se ew and the service is amazing. Very friendly staff and cool atmosphere, especially for this part of the city.
author: Lauren P.

description:
food was good and the prices reasonable
the staff was friendly
the time it took to deliver the meal was awful! we nearly walked uped
author: b k.
